I think the Catholic Church needs to change some things.
Some people are leaving the Church because it does not accept certain beliefs.
For example, the Church is against gay marriage and abortion.
It has old ideas about these things.
If it changes a little, it might keep more people.
Many people disagree with the Church's views.
They think the Church is not modern enough.
They may not want to follow a Church that does not agree with their beliefs.
I think priests should be allowed to get married.
But I don't know if that would stop people leaving.
I don't know if priests being married would change their behavior.
Everyone else can have both a job and a family.
So, why not priests?

I do not oppose gay marriage. I think people are born this way and it is not a choice. So, I do not think people should be blamed for their sexual orientation. It is wrong to say that only a man and a woman can marry, but not two people of the same sex. The federal government should not be involved in this issue because it is not a legal or moral concern. It is not about the security of our country. People should be free to live their lives as they choose, and the federal government should not interfere. It is not fair to punish people for who they are.

I believe that gay marriage should be legal.
There is no good reason to stop it.
Some people think that homosexual couples harm the heterosexual family. But this is not true.
There are many differences between gay and straight relationships.
It is like two sides of the same coin.
Gay couples have the same rights as straight couples.
They should have the same civil rights.
This includes property taxes and health care.
If a gay couple is together, their partner should be allowed to visit them in the hospital.
Gay couples have the same success rates in relationships as straight couples.
They are just in a different relationship.
Gay couples are not asking to get married in a church.
They just want a marriage certificate.
This should not be a problem if it does not involve church and state.
Some people do not like gay couples adopting children.
But gay couples can be good parents.
They can involve themselves in the community like straight couples.
The federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state.
The amendment should be changed to allow it.
President Bush has strong beliefs about this.
He believes it is against his religion.
He believes it is like abortion and stem cell research.
It is important to listen to research and studies.
People should not make laws based only on what is popular or their religion.
Many people are against gay marriage because they think gay people are damaged.
This is not true.
The American Psychological Association says so.
People should listen to research and studies.

I work at a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Just because a drug is illegal does not mean it has useful properties. Therefore, I do not think it should be available for the public. However, if the drug is beneficial for medicinal use, I would support its availability. For example, oxycodone and vicodin are illegal but useful for pain relief. Now that marijuana is legal in some places, we should consider its medicinal use too. It is not similar to alcohol because it is not as harmful. We should gradually legalize marijuana and remove the bad image people have of it. Then people can use it responsibly for medical purposes.

I go church every Sunday when young.
Now they have teen mass and cut it down to thirty minutes.
People wear casual clothes.
Even families late.
I think this change make church more casual.
People wear jeans, khakis.
[OK what about priests and pedophilia?]
I think not prevent with marriage.
Some married men still have problem.
I think it genetics not choice.
[OK any thoughts on church itself?]
No.

I was okay with the idea but, after September 11th, everyone was very upset. The war in Iraq did not seem right. The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction and was connected to Bin Laden. This was not true. Colin Powell also said he was not sure about the evidence. This is a big problem. The Bush administration did not respect the constitution and tried to change it. They wanted to go to war. Some people said the younger Bush wanted revenge on Iraq because of his father's administration. I think they also wanted more oil. This has gone on too long. If we leave now, Iraq might have a civil war and more people could die. Some people think other countries should help. However, this could cause more problems because Iraq's independence might be a big issue. The interim government is not strong and radical groups are fighting for control. The political process is very difficult.

I do not like discussing the War in Iraq.
It started because we thought Iraq did the terrorist attacks on September 11.
But I do not think it is a real war.
The United States has no declared it.
I do not know much about it.
I know we stay there to try to build democracy.
But I do not think it is fair.
It is wasting our resources.
I feel bad for President Bush.
It makes him look bad.
It is like the Vietnam War.
It was never really declared.
I do not know if we should stay or leave.
If we leave, Iraq will be angry.
If we stay, it will take a long time to build democracy.
It might cause more problems.
It might make Al-Qaida stronger.
I think the war will go on for a long time.
That is all I can say.

I feel it is not right to make it legal. I think it should be up to the churches to decide. The constitution says separation of church and state. Most churches are against it. Only in Boston and some areas, some churches support it. I think the government should not decide what churches can allow or not allow. The constitution already says this. Trying to make an amendment about this would be wrong. It would restrict people, not the government. I do not think the government should be involved in this issue. The president is pushing for this amendment because it is against his own beliefs as a Catholic. It is not about the economy or society. The amendment would only show he has a preference for one religion over others. I think the churches should decide this issue.

The Iraq War
The government did not fully tell the truth about why the war started. They said it was linked to the September 11 attacks, but it was not true. They also wanted to find weapons of mass destruction in Iraq, but they were never found. The government used this to make American people angry and support the war. The war started in 2003.

I did not agree with the war, especially because it was a preemptive strike. I also thought it was like the Vietnam War. The government did not plan well for what would happen after they removed the Iraqi government. Many American soldiers died, and the government was not ready to handle the situation. They thought it would be easy to make Iraq a democratic country, but it was not true. It is difficult to make a new government in a country.

The government also did not plan well for the Iraq War. They thought it would be easy to make Iraq a democratic country, but it was not true. It is difficult to make a new government in a country. They also wanted to find weapons of mass destruction in Iraq, but they were never found. The government used this to make American people angry and support the war.

The war in Iraq was a difficult decision. It is hard to decide to go to war, but it is also hard to abandon a country after you have gone to war there. We should try to finish what we started, but it is also important to consider the American soldiers who have died. There are also many Iraqis who want to live in a democratic country, but it will take a long time to make it happen. The government should have been more honest with the American people about what would happen in Iraq.

I like gay marriage. I always have. I think it's a personal choice. It is not a choice based on society. It is natural. Some people think it's not natural. They think it's wrong. I don't agree. I think it's unfair to take away rights from people because of something they cannot control. I think it's cruel.

I have been an advocate for gay marriage. I don't think the government should have a say in this. It's a personal choice. It should be between two people, not the government. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples. They live like any other family. They take their dogs out for a walk. I don't see the problem.

George Bush tried to say what marriage is. I think that's crazy. Marriage should be between two people who love each other. It should not be about politics or religion.

I think being gay is natural. It's like a chemical thing in the brain. It's not about growing up with sisters or not having a father. I think it's unfair to blame someone for something they cannot control.

I think marriage should be private. If a man and a woman want to get married, they can do it secretly. If two gay people want to get married, it's a big deal. It should be a private matter, not a public one.

No, I don't think the government should say who can and cannot get married.

When you put information on the internet, it becomes public. You cannot control what people think. If you talk about harmful activities, the school may take action. They cannot ignore it, in case something happens. Sometimes, people make jokes, but the school cannot take that chance. The school might check your internet accounts if there is a warning. It is not an invasion of privacy, because you gave others access to your accounts. If you don’t want something to be seen, don’t put it on the internet. It is important to be careful about what you share online.

I think the war has been too long.
The purpose was good at first.
We wanted to give democracy to another country.
But we have lost this purpose.
Now, we may be fighting just to show we are strong.
Maybe the original reason was not good.
George Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein.
I think the main reason was good.
But now, we do not have a good reason.
The war has been too long.
We had our first success in a few months.
But it has gone on for years.
I think we should stop now.
They must take care of themselves.
We have our own problems, like poverty.
We should spend our money on these things, not war.
We should not spend money on war forever.
We have many problems, like schools and healthcare.
We should spend our money on these things, not war.

I want to understand something. I saw that someone found information online. Was this okay?
It is allowed to look at profiles on sites like Myspace. People agree to share their information when they make friends.
But, I am worried about privacy. Some people see information and use it in bad ways.
It is hard to know who can see what. I do not want my profile to be seen by people I do not know.
I use Facebook to talk to friends, but I worry about what others might see.
Should schools stop students from using Myspace? It is hard to say. It depends on why the schools want to do this.
My roommate told me that her high school stopped students from having Myspace. I do not know if this is right.
It is complicated. It is hard to protect privacy.

I have something to talk about. First, there is the war in Iraq. I feel it is wrong to talk about it because it is over. The people of Iraq do not want us to stay. Most people think it was a bad idea. The situation is not good. The Middle East is different from the United States. Democracy does not work there as it does here. Saddam Hussein was bad, but the war was not the answer. It was a mistake. There is no clear way to fix it. I do not understand why we should stay. The people of Iraq want us to leave. It is better for us to leave. If we ask them if we should leave, then it is not our fault if things get worse. We can help them later if we leave now. We will be the good guys. We will not be the good guys if we stay. It will be better for us to leave now.

Yes, I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It affects women and men, not only in jobs but also in different fields. For example, in business, a woman might be qualified for a job, but people might not promote her because historically, women have had less power in business. Men also face issues. For instance, if a man stays at home to care for children, some people might think he is not a real man. In the fashion industry, people might not take a man seriously if he is into fashion. This is because they think men do not understand fashion well.

Discrimination is hard to change because society thinks in a certain way. We have made progress, but change happens slowly. If women become CEOs and men stay at home, people start to accept it more. To change society, we should promote good qualities. If we push change too fast, people resist it. We have come far, but change takes time.

There is also discrimination based on where you are from. For example, if someone grew up on a farm and has bad grammar, people might not respect them. This is true for both men and women. Change is slow, but we are making progress.

They legalized marijuana.They changed it from a crime to a traffic ticket.This means if people are caught with it, they get a ticket, not a criminal record.This makes it not so bad for jobs and other things.But it is still a drug charge, so there are still bad effects.The city has more money now.They use it for schools and programs for old people and homeless people.The city is kind of open-minded about it, so people think it's okay.But it should not be everywhere.Smoking it can cause problems, like driving and public places.It is not normal in society.They should not make it like cigarettes.It is not as bad as alcohol, but it can affect people's lives.Each person reacts differently, so it's hard to say how it will affect everyone.

People do things in old ways.

I am not sure what to think about this issue.
I believe it is a difficult topic because it is close to the separation of church and state.
People might feel offended if we talk about marriage in this way.
I think that civil unions should be the same as marriage.
The government should not look at what kind of marriage it is.
If people are married, they should just be considered as having a civil union.
Gay marriage is the same as any other marriage.
If all states agree, they should make it a federal law.
A constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not necessary.
The constitution should not be changed for this issue.
It is not important enough to amend the constitution.

I grew up in a Christian home. Homosexuality is a difficult topic for me. I have many gay friends, but I do not agree with their lifestyle. However, I believe it should be legalized. I do not think it should be a national issue. I think each state should decide on its own. Many states are democratic, and they push for gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you know its feelings about this. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. Therefore, I think gay marriage should be legalized based on each state's decision. The president should not decide for the whole country. Bush should not ban gay marriage. He does not live in every state and should not decide how each state runs itself. I think some issues should be left up to each individual state. Plus, the president will be out of office in two years. If a democratic president wants to lift the ban, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each individual state because they will have to live with the decision, not the president.

Myspace is a public space. If students post on it, others can see it. This is true even if school officials do.

If school officials see something on Myspace that shows students in danger, they have a right to see it. This can help keep students safe.

School officials should not use Myspace to catch students doing wrong things. This would be an invasion of privacy.

However, if seeing something on Myspace helps make the school safer, it is okay. Parents trust schools to keep their children safe.

School officials have a responsibility to make the school safe. They may use Myspace to check if students are in danger.

They might use Myspace to learn if students are drinking, smoking, or doing other wrong things. This can help them keep students safe.

If something on Myspace leads to school officials making the school safer, then it is okay for them to see it.

I am against school officials checking students on Myspace just to catch them doing wrong things. However, if it helps make the school safer, it is okay.

Everything posted on Myspace is public. Once it is on the internet, it is always there.

Schools must be safe places for students. School officials must do everything they can to make sure this happens.

I was very upset after nine eleven. I wanted to go to the place where it happened and do something. But I did not think we were ready. We did not have a good plan. I think it was all emotion and anger. Now I do not think we should be there anymore. We should leave. They are not like us. They fight with each other. They do not want to change. We cannot make them better. We should not be there. It is not working. We should leave.

I think the Catholic Church needs to change some things.
Some people are leaving the Church because it does not accept certain beliefs.
For example, the Church is against gay marriage and abortion.
It has old ideas about these things.
If it changes a little, it might keep more people.
Many people disagree with the Church's views.
They think the Church is not modern enough.
They may not want to follow a Church that does not agree with their beliefs.
I think priests should be allowed to get married.
But I don't know if that would stop people leaving.
I don't know if priests being married would change their behavior.
Everyone else can have both a job and a family.
So, why not priests?

I do not oppose gay marriage. I think people are born this way and it is not a choice. So, I do not think people should be blamed for their sexual orientation. It is wrong to say that only a man and a woman can marry, but not two people of the same sex. The federal government should not be involved in this issue because it is not a legal or moral concern. It is not about the security of our country. People should be free to live their lives as they choose, and the federal government should not interfere. It is not fair to punish people for who they are.

I believe that gay marriage should be legal.
There is no good reason to stop it.
Some people think that homosexual couples harm the heterosexual family. But this is not true.
There are many differences between gay and straight relationships.
It is like two sides of the same coin.
Gay couples have the same rights as straight couples.
They should have the same civil rights.
This includes property taxes and health care.
If a gay couple is together, their partner should be allowed to visit them in the hospital.
Gay couples have the same success rates in relationships as straight couples.
They are just in a different relationship.
Gay couples are not asking to get married in a church.
They just want a marriage certificate.
This should not be a problem if it does not involve church and state.
Some people do not like gay couples adopting children.
But gay couples can be good parents.
They can involve themselves in the community like straight couples.
The federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state.
The amendment should be changed to allow it.
President Bush has strong beliefs about this.
He believes it is against his religion.
He believes it is like abortion and stem cell research.
It is important to listen to research and studies.
People should not make laws based only on what is popular or their religion.
Many people are against gay marriage because they think gay people are damaged.
This is not true.
The American Psychological Association says so.
People should listen to research and studies.

I work at a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Just because a drug is illegal does not mean it has useful properties. Therefore, I do not think it should be available for the public. However, if the drug is beneficial for medicinal use, I would support its availability. For example, oxycodone and vicodin are illegal but useful for pain relief. Now that marijuana is legal in some places, we should consider its medicinal use too. It is not similar to alcohol because it is not as harmful. We should gradually legalize marijuana and remove the bad image people have of it. Then people can use it responsibly for medical purposes.

I was okay with the idea but, after September 11th, everyone was very upset. The war in Iraq did not seem right. The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction and was connected to Bin Laden. This was not true. Colin Powell also said he was not sure about the evidence. This is a big problem. The Bush administration did not respect the constitution and tried to change it. They wanted to go to war. Some people said the younger Bush wanted revenge on Iraq because of his father's administration. I think they also wanted more oil. This has gone on too long. If we leave now, Iraq might have a civil war and more people could die. Some people think other countries should help. However, this could cause more problems because Iraq's independence might be a big issue. The interim government is not strong and radical groups are fighting for control. The political process is very difficult.

I do not like discussing the War in Iraq.
It started because we thought Iraq did the terrorist attacks on September 11.
But I do not think it is a real war.
The United States has no declared it.
I do not know much about it.
I know we stay there to try to build democracy.
But I do not think it is fair.
It is wasting our resources.
I feel bad for President Bush.
It makes him look bad.
It is like the Vietnam War.
It was never really declared.
I do not know if we should stay or leave.
If we leave, Iraq will be angry.
If we stay, it will take a long time to build democracy.
It might cause more problems.
It might make Al-Qaida stronger.
I think the war will go on for a long time.
That is all I can say.

I feel it is not right to make it legal. I think it should be up to the churches to decide. The constitution says separation of church and state. Most churches are against it. Only in Boston and some areas, some churches support it. I think the government should not decide what churches can allow or not allow. The constitution already says this. Trying to make an amendment about this would be wrong. It would restrict people, not the government. I do not think the government should be involved in this issue. The president is pushing for this amendment because it is against his own beliefs as a Catholic. It is not about the economy or society. The amendment would only show he has a preference for one religion over others. I think the churches should decide this issue.

The Iraq War
The government did not fully tell the truth about why the war started. They said it was linked to the September 11 attacks, but it was not true. They also wanted to find weapons of mass destruction in Iraq, but they were never found. The government used this to make American people angry and support the war. The war started in 2003.

I did not agree with the war, especially because it was a preemptive strike. I also thought it was like the Vietnam War. The government did not plan well for what would happen after they removed the Iraqi government. Many American soldiers died, and the government was not ready to handle the situation. They thought it would be easy to make Iraq a democratic country, but it was not true. It is difficult to make a new government in a country.

The government also did not plan well for the Iraq War. They thought it would be easy to make Iraq a democratic country, but it was not true. It is difficult to make a new government in a country. They also wanted to find weapons of mass destruction in Iraq, but they were never found. The government used this to make American people angry and support the war.

The war in Iraq was a difficult decision. It is hard to decide to go to war, but it is also hard to abandon a country after you have gone to war there. We should try to finish what we started, but it is also important to consider the American soldiers who have died. There are also many Iraqis who want to live in a democratic country, but it will take a long time to make it happen. The government should have been more honest with the American people about what would happen in Iraq.

I like gay marriage. I always have. I think it's a personal choice. It is not a choice based on society. It is natural. Some people think it's not natural. They think it's wrong. I don't agree. I think it's unfair to take away rights from people because of something they cannot control. I think it's cruel.

I have been an advocate for gay marriage. I don't think the government should have a say in this. It's a personal choice. It should be between two people, not the government. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples. They live like any other family. They take their dogs out for a walk. I don't see the problem.

George Bush tried to say what marriage is. I think that's crazy. Marriage should be between two people who love each other. It should not be about politics or religion.

I think being gay is natural. It's like a chemical thing in the brain. It's not about growing up with sisters or not having a father. I think it's unfair to blame someone for something they cannot control.

I think marriage should be private. If a man and a woman want to get married, they can do it secretly. If two gay people want to get married, it's a big deal. It should be a private matter, not a public one.

No, I don't think the government should say who can and cannot get married.

When you put information on the internet, it becomes public. You cannot control what people think. If you talk about harmful activities, the school may take action. They cannot ignore it, in case something happens. Sometimes, people make jokes, but the school cannot take that chance. The school might check your internet accounts if there is a warning. It is not an invasion of privacy, because you gave others access to your accounts. If you don’t want something to be seen, don’t put it on the internet. It is important to be careful about what you share online.

I think the war has been too long.
The purpose was good at first.
We wanted to give democracy to another country.
But we have lost this purpose.
Now, we may be fighting just to show we are strong.
Maybe the original reason was not good.
George Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein.
I think the main reason was good.
But now, we do not have a good reason.
The war has been too long.
We had our first success in a few months.
But it has gone on for years.
I think we should stop now.
They must take care of themselves.
We have our own problems, like poverty.
We should spend our money on these things, not war.
We should not spend money on war forever.
We have many problems, like schools and healthcare.
We should spend our money on these things, not war.

I want to understand something. I saw that someone found information online. Was this okay?
It is allowed to look at profiles on sites like Myspace. People agree to share their information when they make friends.
But, I am worried about privacy. Some people see information and use it in bad ways.
It is hard to know who can see what. I do not want my profile to be seen by people I do not know.
I use Facebook to talk to friends, but I worry about what others might see.
Should schools stop students from using Myspace? It is hard to say. It depends on why the schools want to do this.
My roommate told me that her high school stopped students from having Myspace. I do not know if this is right.
It is complicated. It is hard to protect privacy.

I have something to talk about. First, there is the war in Iraq. I feel it is wrong to talk about it because it is over. The people of Iraq do not want us to stay. Most people think it was a bad idea. The situation is not good. The Middle East is different from the United States. Democracy does not work there as it does here. Saddam Hussein was bad, but the war was not the answer. It was a mistake. There is no clear way to fix it. I do not understand why we should stay. The people of Iraq want us to leave. It is better for us to leave. If we ask them if we should leave, then it is not our fault if things get worse. We can help them later if we leave now. We will be the good guys. We will not be the good guys if we stay. It will be better for us to leave now.

Yes, I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It affects women and men, not only in jobs but also in different fields. For example, in business, a woman might be qualified for a job, but people might not promote her because historically, women have had less power in business. Men also face issues. For instance, if a man stays at home to care for children, some people might think he is not a real man. In the fashion industry, people might not take a man seriously if he is into fashion. This is because they think men do not understand fashion well.

Discrimination is hard to change because society thinks in a certain way. We have made progress, but change happens slowly. If women become CEOs and men stay at home, people start to accept it more. To change society, we should promote good qualities. If we push change too fast, people resist it. We have come far, but change takes time.

There is also discrimination based on where you are from. For example, if someone grew up on a farm and has bad grammar, people might not respect them. This is true for both men and women. Change is slow, but we are making progress.

They legalized marijuana.They changed it from a crime to a traffic ticket.This means if people are caught with it, they get a ticket, not a criminal record.This makes it not so bad for jobs and other things.But it is still a drug charge, so there are still bad effects.The city has more money now.They use it for schools and programs for old people and homeless people.The city is kind of open-minded about it, so people think it's okay.But it should not be everywhere.Smoking it can cause problems, like driving and public places.It is not normal in society.They should not make it like cigarettes.It is not as bad as alcohol, but it can affect people's lives.Each person reacts differently, so it's hard to say how it will affect everyone.

I am not sure what to think about this issue.
I believe it is a difficult topic because it is close to the separation of church and state.
People might feel offended if we talk about marriage in this way.
I think that civil unions should be the same as marriage.
The government should not look at what kind of marriage it is.
If people are married, they should just be considered as having a civil union.
Gay marriage is the same as any other marriage.
If all states agree, they should make it a federal law.
A constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not necessary.
The constitution should not be changed for this issue.
It is not important enough to amend the constitution.

I grew up in a Christian home. Homosexuality is a difficult topic for me. I have many gay friends, but I do not agree with their lifestyle. However, I believe it should be legalized. I do not think it should be a national issue. I think each state should decide on its own. Many states are democratic, and they push for gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you know its feelings about this. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. Therefore, I think gay marriage should be legalized based on each state's decision. The president should not decide for the whole country. Bush should not ban gay marriage. He does not live in every state and should not decide how each state runs itself. I think some issues should be left up to each individual state. Plus, the president will be out of office in two years. If a democratic president wants to lift the ban, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each individual state because they will have to live with the decision, not the president.

Myspace is a public space. If students post on it, others can see it. This is true even if school officials do.

If school officials see something on Myspace that shows students in danger, they have a right to see it. This can help keep students safe.

School officials should not use Myspace to catch students doing wrong things. This would be an invasion of privacy.

However, if seeing something on Myspace helps make the school safer, it is okay. Parents trust schools to keep their children safe.

School officials have a responsibility to make the school safe. They may use Myspace to check if students are in danger.

They might use Myspace to learn if students are drinking, smoking, or doing other wrong things. This can help them keep students safe.

If something on Myspace leads to school officials making the school safer, then it is okay for them to see it.

I am against school officials checking students on Myspace just to catch them doing wrong things. However, if it helps make the school safer, it is okay.

Everything posted on Myspace is public. Once it is on the internet, it is always there.

Schools must be safe places for students. School officials must do everything they can to make sure this happens.

I was very upset after nine eleven. I wanted to go to the place where it happened and do something. But I did not think we were ready. We did not have a good plan. I think it was all emotion and anger. Now I do not think we should be there anymore. We should leave. They are not like us. They fight with each other. They do not want to change. I think the Catholic Church needs to change some things.
Some people are leaving the Church because it does not accept certain beliefs.
For example, the Church is against gay marriage and abortion.
It has old ideas about these things.
If it changes a little, it might keep more people.
Many people disagree with the Church's views.
They think the Church is not modern enough.
They may not want to follow a Church that does not agree with their beliefs.
I think priests should be allowed to get married.
But I don't know if that would stop people leaving.
I don't know if priests being married would change their behavior.
Everyone else can have both a job and a family.
So, why not priests?

I do not oppose gay marriage. I think people are born this way and it is not a choice. So, I do not think people should be blamed for their sexual orientation. It is wrong to say that only a man and a woman can marry, but not two people of the same sex. The federal government should not be involved in this issue because it is not a legal or moral concern. It is not about the security of our country. People should be free to live their lives as they choose, and the federal government should not interfere. It is not fair to punish people for who they are.

I believe that gay marriage should be legal.
There is no good reason to stop it.
Some people think that homosexual couples harm the heterosexual family. But this is not true.
There are many differences between gay and straight relationships.
It is like two sides of the same coin.
Gay couples have the same rights as straight couples.
They should have the same civil rights.
This includes property taxes and health care.
If a gay couple is together, their partner should be allowed to visit them in the hospital.
Gay couples have the same success rates in relationships as straight couples.
They are just in a different relationship.
Gay couples are not asking to get married in a church.
They just want a marriage certificate.
This should not be a problem if it does not involve church and state.
Some people do not like gay couples adopting children.
But gay couples can be good parents.
They can involve themselves in the community like straight couples.
The federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state.
The amendment should be changed to allow it.
President Bush has strong beliefs about this.
He believes it is against his religion.
He believes it is like abortion and stem cell research.
It is important to listen to research and studies.
People should not make laws based only on what is popular or their religion.
Many people are against gay marriage because they think gay people are damaged.
This is not true.
The American Psychological Association says so.
People should listen to research and studies.

I work at a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Just because a drug is illegal does not mean it has useful properties. Therefore, I do not think it should be available for the public. However, if the drug is beneficial for medicinal use, I would support its availability. For example, oxycodone and vicodin are illegal but useful for pain relief. Now that marijuana is legal in some places, we should consider its medicinal use too. It is not similar to alcohol because it is not as harmful. We should gradually legalize marijuana and remove the bad image people have of it. Then people can use it responsibly for medical purposes.

I was okay with the idea but, after September 11th, everyone was very upset. The war in Iraq did not seem right. The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction and was connected to Bin Laden. This was not true. Colin Powell also said he was not sure about the evidence. This is a big problem. The Bush administration did not respect the constitution and tried to change it. They wanted to go to war. Some people said the younger Bush wanted revenge on Iraq because of his father's administration. I think they also wanted more oil. This has gone on too long. If we leave now, Iraq might have a civil war and more people could die. Some people think other countries should help. However, this could cause more problems because Iraq's independence might be a big issue. The interim government is not strong and radical groups are fighting for control. The political process is very difficult.

I do not like discussing the War in Iraq.
It started because we thought Iraq did the terrorist attacks on September 11.
But I do not think it is a real war.
The United States has no declared it.
I do not know much about it.
I know we stay there to try to build democracy.
But I do not think it is fair.
It is wasting our resources.
I feel bad for President Bush.
It makes him look bad.
It is like the Vietnam War.
It was never really declared.
I do not know if we should stay or leave.
If we leave, Iraq will be angry.
If we stay, it will take a long time to build democracy.
It might cause more problems.
It might make Al-Qaida stronger.
I think the war will go on for a long time.
That is all I can say.

I feel it is not right to make it legal. I think it should be up to the churches to decide. The constitution says separation of church and state. Most churches are against it. Only in Boston and some areas, some churches support it. I think the government should not decide what churches can allow or not allow. The constitution already says this. Trying to make an amendment about this would be wrong. It would restrict people, not the government. I do not think the government should be involved in this issue. The president is pushing for this amendment because it is against his own beliefs as a Catholic. It is not about the economy or society. The amendment would only show he has a preference for one religion over others. I think the churches should decide this issue.

The Iraq War
The government did not fully tell the truth about why the war started. They said it was linked to the September 11 attacks, but it was not true. They also wanted to find weapons of mass destruction in Iraq, but they were never found. The government used this to make American people angry and support the war. The war started in 2003.

I did not agree with the war, especially because it was a preemptive strike. I also thought it was like the Vietnam War. The government did not plan well for what would happen after they removed the Iraqi government. Many American soldiers died, and the government was not ready to handle the situation. They thought it would be easy to make Iraq a democratic country, but it was not true. It is difficult to make a new government in a country.

The government also did not plan well for the Iraq War. They thought it would be easy to make Iraq a democratic country, but it was not true. It is difficult to make a new government in a country. They also wanted to find weapons of mass destruction in Iraq, but they were never found. The government used this to make American people angry and support the war.

The war in Iraq was a difficult decision. It is hard to decide to go to war, but it is also hard to abandon a country after you have gone to war there. We should try to finish what we started, but it is also important to consider the American soldiers who have died. There are also many Iraqis who want to live in a democratic country, but it will take a long time to make it happen. The government should have been more honest with the American people about what would happen in Iraq.

I like gay marriage. I always have. I think it's a personal choice. It is not a choice based on society. It is natural. Some people think it's not natural. They think it's wrong. I don't agree. I think it's unfair to take away rights from people because of something they cannot control. I think it's cruel.

I have been an advocate for gay marriage. I don't think the government should have a say in this. It's a personal choice. It should be between two people, not the government. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples. They live like any other family. They take their dogs out for a walk. I don't see the problem.

George Bush tried to say what marriage is. I think that's crazy. Marriage should be between two people who love each other. It should not be about politics or religion.

I think being gay is natural. It's like a chemical thing in the brain. It's not about growing up with sisters or not having a father. I think it's unfair to blame someone for something they cannot control.

I think marriage should be private. If a man and a woman want to get married, they can do it secretly. If two gay people want to get married, it's a big deal. It should be a private matter, not a public one.

No, I don't think the government should say who can and cannot get married.

I have something to talk about. First, there is the war in Iraq. I feel it is wrong to talk about it because it is over. The people of Iraq do not want us to stay. Most people think it was a bad idea. The situation is not good. The Middle East is different from the United States. Democracy does not work there as it does here. Saddam Hussein was bad, but the war was not the answer. It was a mistake. There is no clear way to fix it. I do not understand why we should stay. The people of Iraq want us to leave. It is better for us to leave. If we ask them if we should leave, then it is not our fault if things get worse. We can help them later if we leave now. We will be the good guys. We will not be the good guys if we stay. It will be better for us to leave now.

Yes, I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It affects women and men, not only in jobs but also in different fields. For example, in business, a woman might be qualified for a job, but people might not promote her because historically, women have had less power in business. Men also face issues. For instance, if a man stays at home to care for children, some people might think he is not a real man. In the fashion industry, people might not take a man seriously if he is into fashion. This is because they think men do not understand fashion well.

Discrimination is hard to change because society thinks in a certain way. We have made progress, but change happens slowly. If women become CEOs and men stay at home, people start to accept it more. To change society, we should promote good qualities. If we push change too fast, people resist it. We have come far, but change takes time.

There is also discrimination based on where you are from. For example, if someone grew up on a farm and has bad grammar, people might not respect them. This is true for both men and women. Change is slow, but we are making progress.

I am not sure what to think about this issue.
I believe it is a difficult topic because it is close to the separation of church and state.
People might feel offended if we talk about marriage in this way.
I think that civil unions should be the same as marriage.
The government should not look at what kind of marriage it is.
If people are married, they should just be considered as having a civil union.
Gay marriage is the same as any other marriage.
If all states agree, they should make it a federal law.
A constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not necessary.
The constitution should not be changed for this issue.
It is not important enough to amend the constitution.

I grew up in a Christian home. Homosexuality is a difficult topic for me. I have many gay friends, but I do not agree with their lifestyle. However, I believe it should be legalized. I do not think it should be a national issue. I think each state should decide on its own. Many states are democratic, and they push for gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you know its feelings about this. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. Therefore, I think gay marriage should be legalized based on each state's decision. The president should not decide for the whole country. Bush should not ban gay marriage. He does not live in every state and should not decide how each state runs itself. I think some issues should be left up to each individual state. Plus, the president will be out of office in two years. If a democratic president wants to lift the ban, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each individual state because they will have to live with the decision, not the president.

Myspace is a public space. If students post on it, others can see it. This is true even if school officials do.

If school officials see something on Myspace that shows students in danger, they have a right to see it. This can help keep students safe.

School officials should not use Myspace to catch students doing wrong things. This would be an invasion of privacy.

However, if seeing something on Myspace helps make the school safer, it is okay. Parents trust schools to keep their children safe.

School officials have a responsibility to make the school safe. They may use Myspace to check if students are in danger.

They might use Myspace to learn if students are drinking, smoking, or doing other wrong things. This can help them keep students safe.

If something on Myspace leads to school officials making the school safer, then it is okay for them to see it.

I am against school officials checking students on Myspace just to catch them doing wrong things. However, if it helps make the school safer, it is okay.

Everything posted on Myspace is public. Once it is on the internet, it is always there.

Schools must be safe places for students. School officials must do everything they can to make sure this happens.

I was very upset after nine eleven. I wanted to go to the place where it happened and do something. But I did not think we were ready. We did not have a good plan. I think it was all emotion and anger. Now I do not think we should be there anymore. We should leave. They are not like us. They fight with each other. They do not want to change. We cannot make them better. We should not be there. It is not working. We should leave.

transformed_texts: I believe the Catholic Church should change some things. Their old views make people leave. People feel the Church is not accepting. They do not like the Church's views on gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. Some people do not agree with the Church. They think the Church's views are old-fashioned. If the Church changed, it would not lose followers. Some people like the Church, but some do not. They think the Church's views are wrong about these subjects. People do not want to follow something they disagree with. I do not see a reason why priests cannot be married or have female priests. It might not have stopped people from leaving. The Church's rule about priests being married to God is not a good reason. Everyone else can have a job and a family. Priests should be able to do the same. I do not think the Church should be against these things. It should be more accepting.

I am not against same-sex marriage. I believe people are born this way. It is not a choice. Therefore, we should not hold them responsible for their sexual orientation. It is wrong to say one man and one woman can marry but two people of the same sex cannot. The federal government should not interfere. This is not a legal or moral issue. It does not affect our country's security. People are who they are. They should not be punished for being gay.

I think that gay marriage should be legalized because there is no good reason not to. People often think that homosexual couples threaten the heterosexual family, but it is different. There are many aspects to it. It is like two different sides of the same coin. Heads will never be tails, but it is the same thing. There are civil rights involved, such as property taxes and healthcare. If you are in a gay couple, your partner cannot be in the room with you if you are sick or visit you. This is not fair if you spend the rest of your life with someone.

Many scientific studies have been done because it is a hot topic. Homosexual couples have the same success rates and relationship factors as heterosexual couples. It is just a relationship. People worry about adoption issues and community issues, such as how gay couples will affect the community and how children will adjust to society. But parenting skills are the same in gay couples as in straight couples. They can be community involved or not, like heterosexual couples.

The federal government should be very involved in this issue. They should make gay marriage legal in every state. I think the amendment should just be the opposite. But President Bush has strong views about gay marriage. He thinks it goes along with his views on abortion and stem cell research. Most reasons for not allowing gay marriage are moral reasons. Morality differs from person to person. Embracing the morality of one group while ignoring others is unethical. It is hypocritical to create an amendment banning gay marriage based on religious beliefs, especially considering the controversy about under God in the pledge of allegiance.

Some people are against gay marriage because they believe gay people are psychologically damaged. This is not true. The American Psychological Association has said so. People should listen to institutions that do research and studies instead of popular opinion. The world would be seen differently if people did this.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I believe illegal drugs may have benefits. For example, drugs like oxycodone, Vicodin, and Percocet are legal. They help people but are controlled. If we deny benefits just because a drug is illegal, it is not right.

I think marijuana should have the same rules. It should be legal. It is not like drugs like heroin or cocaine. It is not as harmful. We should remove the bad image and use it responsibly. People might use it for medical purposes.

If we make it legal slowly, people can use it responsibly. It should not be all at once. That would cause abuse. But first, we should remove the bad image around marijuana.

The church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. As a child, I always went to church on Sundays. I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, church is more casual. People wear jeans or khakis. Some even come in beach clothes from the beach. Families are often late. Church has become more flexible. People wear casual clothes. I do not know the politics of the church. It is not my main concern. Regarding accusations against Catholic priests, these could not have been prevented by allowing female priests or married priests. Some married men commit this crime. It is not about being married or not. Priests choose their path. Other religions allow priests to marry. If priests want to marry and practice their faith, they should consider other religions.

I was okay with the idea at first, but the Iraq War was soon after September 11th. The Bush administration said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. This was not true. They lied to the American people. This is bad. Colin Powell, who gave a big speech about this at the UN, now says he did not believe what he said.

The Bush administration did not care about the constitution. They went to war to get revenge and to get oil. This is wrong. They should not lie to people.

Now, people say the war can end soon. But this may cause a civil war. This is bad. The UN and some other countries suggest a coalition can help. But this may cause more problems.

Many people in Iraq still have different ideas. The government is not working well. The new Prime Minister has little control. This is causing friction and fighting.

I talk about the Iraq War.
It's not a declared war. It started after the 9/11 attacks.
Some people think it's not a good idea to keep fighting.
They say we want oil and democracy.
But it's hard to build democracy in one day.
If we leave, they might be angry.
I don't know much about the war.
I don't like to talk about it.
I think it's better to help them and then leave.
Maybe it will be better for everyone.
I don't know how long it will last.
I'm sorry if I don't help.

I am not sure it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says separation of church and state. It is clear to me that this is a religious issue and should be decided by churches, not the government.

Many people believe this is against their religion. For example, most Catholics and Christians do not support it. Trying to make it illegal would be like one church's belief over another.

Separation of church and state is very important. It lets people follow different religions. Making an amendment about it would not be correct. It would go against what is already in the constitution.

I do not think the federal government or any government should be involved. The president is trying to make this amendment because he is Catholic and has his own beliefs.

It is up to the churches to decide this. The government should not interfere. There is no good reason to make an amendment banning it. It might even help society.

I have said all that I want to say.

Before the war in Iraq began, the government did not tell the truth about the reasons for war. They said the war was to stop terrorism after the September 11th attacks. But this was not true. The war had little to do with the attacks. The government wanted people to be angry about the attacks and support the war.
I do not like war, especially preemptive strikes. The war in Iraq was like the Vietnam War. Many soldiers died. The American government did not plan well for after removing Iraq's government. They did not know what would happen next.
The United States took away Iraq's government and tried to give them a new one. This is like what happened in Vietnam. It will take a long time for democracy to succeed. The American government did not plan well for this.
The war started in 2003 and it is still going on. Many American soldiers are still dying. The Iraqis need time to learn to govern themselves. It will take years. The American government should have known this.
In the 2004 election, I planned to vote for George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to leave Iraq now. We took their government away. We cannot abandon them. But it is also hard to keep risking American lives.
The war started for many reasons. Iraq has oil, which is important for money. The government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but they were not found. Other countries with these weapons are not attacked. The government is not being fair or truthful.
I hope the war ends soon. But I think it will not happen quickly.

I believe gay marriage is a personal choice. It is a matter of people's rights, not something to control. I think it is unfair to take away rights because of something people cannot control. It is not humane. I have always supported gay marriage. I think it is not right for politics or the government to decide this. It is a personal and household issue, not a public one. In my neighborhood, there are two or three gay couples. They live and act like any other family. I think it is ridiculous for President Bush to try to decide how to interpret marriage. He should not decide what people can or cannot do. I think it is not fair that two men or two women wanting to get married are treated differently. I think it should be a private matter. I have read that being gay can be biological, not something influenced by society. I believe this because I have heard from many sources. I think it is unfair that gay people are treated differently. They should have the same rights as everyone else. I think it is not right for the government to decide who can or cannot get married. It should be a personal choice. I think it is unfair that gay people are treated differently than others. They should have the same rights as everyone else.

I put things on the internet. It is public. Many people can see it. As an R.A., I must deal with this. When you put something on the internet, it can change how people think about you. You cannot say things about hurting others. The internet is seen by everyone. If your friend on Myspace sees something, the school will know too. If something serious happens, the school must act. But they do not know what to take seriously. Some people joke about serious things. Schools must check social media if they think a student is dangerous. They cannot invade privacy by looking at private messages. But if a student comes to school, they can check social media. Teachers should not make fake accounts and friend students. I do not want to see my residents' internet pictures if they drink. I do not want to be connected to them on Facebook. It is not my job to monitor their internet use.

The war has lasted too long. The purpose was good at first—to restore democracy. But now, we do it to show we are a strong country. We started the war to overthrow Saddam Hussein, but there were also old problems between his father and George's father. I think our purpose got lost. We should have stopped after a few months. The government there now should fix their own problems. We are spending too much money on this war. We should spend that money on our own problems like poverty. War should not be a long-term plan. We can't say the war is for democracy when we are not helping our own people. It's time to stop the war.

Can I ask a question? I wonder if something happened because someone saw information online. I don't think that's an invasion of privacy. On websites like Myspace, if you share information, many people can see it. You might need to be friends with someone to see their profile. But if you accept them, you give them permission. So, if someone saw that information and it prevented harm, that's good. But it's hard for one person to watch everyone's profiles all day. It's not fair to only look at bad kids. I don't think it's right to have someone's job just look at profiles. It depends on why they saw it. If they were looking for evidence, that's different. I don't have Myspace, but I have a Facebook. It makes me nervous, knowing creepy people can see my information. I've seen TV shows about people finding out a lot about others easily. I don't meet strangers, but people sometimes know my screen name and interests. I limit what I post, but I use it to communicate with friends. It's a tricky issue. I only accept people I know. I don't know if it's a privacy issue, but I'm not sure schools can tell students not to have Myspace.

I talk about Iraq War. I feel bad talking about it. I do not join other people who say they were against it. It does not matter anymore. Now, many people think it was a bad idea. Many countries think this. Eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave. Most American troops there also think this. It was a big mistake. The Middle East is different. We cannot change their culture. We should leave. I do not see a reason to stay. I read that eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave now. They are the people we want to help. We should ask them. If they say yes, we should leave. Then we are not responsible if things happen. We can still help. We will be better than now.

Yes, I feel that gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
It is not just women who face this. Men in certain fields also have trouble.
Women can face a glass ceiling, where they cannot get top jobs even if they are the best qualified.
People may not promote a woman to a position because historically, women are not often in high business positions.
Men who stay at home with children can also face discrimination. Society may think that men should work and make money.
In the fashion industry, some people may not take men seriously if they are interested in fashion.
Sometimes, this can happen because men in fashion have different styles of life.
Depending on the job, there can be discrimination from other men or women.
To change this, it is important to be patient. Women are getting more accepted in business, and stay-at-home dads are also becoming more accepted.
It is important to show the good qualities of people who are stereotyped.
If we push too hard, people will resist change. We have come a long way, and change takes time.
Yes, there can also be discrimination from other men or women depending on the job and where someone grew up.
Sometimes, people may not take someone seriously if they do not speak well.
This is another example of discrimination.

They changed the law. They made it less bad.
Instead of a crime, it is like a traffic ticket.
This means if you get caught, it is not as bad.
It is not like a drug charge that can be bad for jobs.
But, the law change has costs. It costs money to arrest and hold people.
And it costs money to have them in court.
Some places do not want to spend money on this.
But in places like Denver, people think it is good.
They think it can help with money for schools and other programs.
They think it is good because they do not want to have it everywhere.
They think it should not be like cigarettes.
They think it should not be smoked everywhere.
They think it should not be smoked while driving.
They think it is not ok to smoke marijuana in many places.
Some people think alcohol is more bad for driving.
But marijuana can be bad for lifestyle.
Like no two people react the same with substances.
Some people are normal, and some are not.
So, it is hard to talk about substances.
They can have different bad effects.
But they both have bad effects.
No, I do not think so.

I think that many things in the Catholic Church are traditional. This is good because it helps to keep the faith strong.

But, it is also important to be able to change and adapt. Sometimes, the Church's rules seem strict and not accepting of people who are not perfect Catholics or who follow other religions. For example, my parents were not married in the Catholic Church because my dad was an Episcopalian. This is not very tolerant.

The Church teaches us to love others, but then it does not accept them. This can feel hypocritical.

I think it would be good to let priests marry. But, I don't think this would stop them from doing bad things like hurting children. This is because it is a different thing to be married than to hurt children.

I think that priests probably would do bad things whether or not they are married. I don't think allowing them to marry would stop these things from happening.

I do not know if gay marriage should be legal. It is a difficult issue. There are two sides. I do not know which side is correct. But I think this is the most difficult topic we face today. It is close to the issue of separation of church and state. And it is hard to define marriage without hurting someone's feelings.

I think all unions, including gay marriages, should be treated the same as a civil union. The government should not treat them differently. People should not be taxed differently. And the government should not ask what kind of marriage it is.

I think if all states agree, then they should try to make it a federal law. But I do not think a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is a good idea. It is an important issue, but it is not big enough to change the constitution.

I do not think the constitution should be amended to ban gay marriage. It is not important enough. It is my opinion that no.

I was raised in a Christian home. So, the subject of homosexuality is a bit unclear to me. I have many gay friends, but I don’t agree with their lifestyle. I believe it should be legal, but I think each state should decide this, not the president. Well, many states are democratic, and many are republican. Democratic states will likely support gay marriage, and republican states will not. If you live in a democratic state, you know how it feels about this topic. I think each state should decide because they chose to live there. I don’t think homosexuals should have fewer opportunities than heterosexuals, so I believe it should be legalized based on each state’s decision. I also don’t think President Bush should decide this for the whole country. He doesn't live in every state, so he shouldn't decide how each state runs itself. I think some issues should be decided by each state. Plus, he will be out of office soon. If a democratic president wants to lift the ban on gay marriage, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state because they will live with the decision. No, I don't think it should be a national issue.

I do not agree. It is not the place of school officials to look at students' Myspace pages. It is a public thing, and students should expect people to see it. But, if school officials are looking for threats to the school or its students, it is different. They should not look at pages just to catch students. They should look only if they have a reason, like preventing a school shooting. I feel this way because it is important for students to feel safe at school. If officials are just looking for trouble, it is an invasion of privacy. However, if they are looking to keep students safe, it is acceptable. Officials should not go on the internet just to catch students. They should only do it if they have a good reason, like preventing a shooting. I agree with this because it helps to protect the students and make the school a safer place.

The war in Iraq
At first, I supported it because of 9/11
I wished to create as much trouble as they did here
I think we didn't plan well
We were unprepared
It backfired
Now, I don't support it
I don't think it helps
People there fight with each other
They can't fight with us if they fight each other
We should leave
We should not interfere
I don't think they are looking to improve their country
They want us to leave
We should not try to change them
We shouldn't stay there forever
It's not helping
We should leave
