If the Church changed, it would not lose followers. Some people like the Church, but some do not. They think the Church's views are wrong about these subjects. People do not want to follow something they disagree with. I do not see a reason why priests cannot be married or have female priests. It might not have stopped people from leaving. The Church's rule about priests being married to God is not a good reason. Everyone else can have a job and a family. Priests should be able to do the same. I do not think the Church should be against these things. It should be more accepting.

I am not against same-sex marriage. I believe people are born this way. It is not a choice. Therefore, we should not hold them responsible for their sexual orientation. It is wrong to say one man and one woman can marry but two people of the same sex cannot. The federal government should not interfere. This is not a legal or moral issue. It does not affect our country's security. People are who they are. They should not be punished for being gay.

I think that gay marriage should be legalized because there is no good reason not to. People often think that homosexual couples threaten the heterosexual family, but it is different. There are many aspects to it. It is like two different sides of the same coin. Heads will never be tails, but it is the same thing. There are civil rights involved, such as property taxes and healthcare. If you are in a gay couple, your partner cannot be in the room with you if you are sick or visit you. This is not fair if you spend the rest of your life with someone.

Many scientific studies have been done because it is a hot topic. Homosexual couples have the same success rates and relationship factors as heterosexual couples. It is just a relationship. People worry about adoption issues and community issues, such as how gay couples will affect the community and how children will adjust to society. But parenting skills are the same in gay couples as in straight couples. They can be community involved or not, like heterosexual couples.

The federal government should be very involved in this issue. They should make gay marriage legal in every state. I think the amendment should just be the opposite. But President Bush has strong views about gay marriage. He thinks it goes along with his views on abortion and stem cell research. Most reasons for not allowing gay marriage are moral reasons. Morality differs from person to person. Embracing the morality of one group while ignoring others is unethical. It is hypocritical to create an amendment banning gay marriage based on religious beliefs, especially considering the controversy about under God in the pledge of allegiance.

Some people are against gay marriage because they believe gay people are psychologically damaged. This is not true. The American Psychological Association has said so. People should listen to institutions that do research and studies instead of popular opinion. The world would be seen differently if people did this.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I believe illegal drugs may have benefits. For example, drugs like oxycodone, Vicodin, and Percocet are legal. They help people but are controlled. If we deny benefits just because a drug is illegal, it is not right.

I think marijuana should have the same rules. It should be legal. It is not like drugs like heroin or cocaine. It is not as harmful. We should remove the bad image and use it responsibly. People might use it for medical purposes.

If we make it legal slowly, people can use it responsibly. It should not be all at once. That would cause abuse. But first, we should remove the bad image around marijuana.

The church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. As a child, I always went to church on Sundays. I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, church is more casual. People wear jeans or khakis. Some even come in beach clothes from the beach. Families are often late. Church has become more flexible. People wear casual clothes. I do not know the politics of the church. It is not my main concern. Regarding accusations against Catholic priests, these could not have been prevented by allowing female priests or married priests. Some married men commit this crime. It is not about being married or not. Priests choose their path. Other religions allow priests to marry. If priests want to marry and practice their faith, they should consider other religions.

I was okay with the idea at first, but the Iraq War was soon after September 11th. The Bush administration said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. This was not true. They lied to the American people. This is bad. Colin Powell, who gave a big speech about this at the UN, now says he did not believe what he said.

The Bush administration did not care about the constitution. They went to war to get revenge and to get oil. This is wrong. They should not lie to people.

Now, people say the war can end soon. But this may cause a civil war. This is bad. The UN and some other countries suggest a coalition can help. But this may cause more problems.

Many people in Iraq still have different ideas. The government is not working well. The new Prime Minister has little control. This is causing friction and fighting.

I talk about the Iraq War.
It's not a declared war. It started after the 9/11 attacks.
Some people think it's not a good idea to keep fighting.
They say we want oil and democracy.
But it's hard to build democracy in one day.
If we leave, they might be angry.
I don't know much about the war.
I don't like to talk about it.
I think it's better to help them and then leave.
Maybe it will be better for everyone.
I don't know how long it will last.
I'm sorry if I don't help.

I am not sure it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says separation of church and state. It is clear to me that this is a religious issue and should be decided by churches, not the government.

Many people believe this is against their religion. For example, most Catholics and Christians do not support it. Trying to make it illegal would be like one church's belief over another.

Separation of church and state is very important. It lets people follow different religions. Making an amendment about it would not be correct. It would go against what is already in the constitution.

I do not think the federal government or any government should be involved. The president is trying to make this amendment because he is Catholic and has his own beliefs.

It is up to the churches to decide this. The government should not interfere. There is no good reason to make an amendment banning it. It might even help society.

I have said all that I want to say.

Before the war in Iraq began, the government did not tell the truth about the reasons for war. They said the war was to stop terrorism after the September 11th attacks. But this was not true. The war had little to do with the attacks. The government wanted people to be angry about the attacks and support the war.
I do not like war, especially preemptive strikes. The war in Iraq was like the Vietnam War. Many soldiers died. The American government did not plan well for after removing Iraq's government. They did not know what would happen next.
The United States took away Iraq's government and tried to give them a new one. This is like what happened in Vietnam. It will take a long time for democracy to succeed. The American government did not plan well for this.
The war started in 2003 and it is still going on. Many American soldiers are still dying. The Iraqis need time to learn to govern themselves. It will take years. The American government should have known this.
In the 2004 election, I planned to vote for George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to leave Iraq now. We took their government away. We cannot abandon them. But it is also hard to keep risking American lives.
The war started for many reasons. Iraq has oil, which is important for money. The government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but they were not found. Other countries with these weapons are not attacked. The government is not being fair or truthful.
I hope the war ends soon. But I think it will not happen quickly.

I believe gay marriage is a personal choice. It is a matter of people's rights, not something to control. I think it is unfair to take away rights because of something people cannot control. It is not humane. I have always supported gay marriage. I think it is not right for politics or the government to decide this. It is a personal and household issue, not a public one. In my neighborhood, there are two or three gay couples. They live and act like any other family. I think it is ridiculous for President Bush to try to decide how to interpret marriage. He should not decide what people can or cannot do. I think it is not fair that two men or two women wanting to get married are treated differently. I think it should be a private matter. I have read that being gay can be biological, not something influenced by society. I believe this because I have heard from many sources. I think it is unfair that gay people are treated differently. They should have the same rights as everyone else. I think it is not right for the government to decide who can or cannot get married. It should be a personal choice. I think it is unfair that gay people are treated differently than others. They should have the same rights as everyone else.

I put things on the internet. It is public. Many people can see it. As an R.A., I must deal with this. When you put something on the internet, it can change how people think about you. You cannot say things about hurting others. The internet is seen by everyone. If your friend on Myspace sees something, the school will know too. If something serious happens, the school must act. But they do not know what to take seriously. Some people joke about serious things. Schools must check social media if they think a student is dangerous. They cannot invade privacy by looking at private messages. But if a student comes to school, they can check social media. Teachers should not make fake accounts and friend students. I do not want to see my residents' internet pictures if they drink. I do not want to be connected to them on Facebook. It is not my job to monitor their internet use.

The war has lasted too long. The purpose was good at first—to restore democracy. But now, we do it to show we are a strong country. We started the war to overthrow Saddam Hussein, but there were also old problems between his father and George's father. I think our purpose got lost. We should have stopped after a few months. The government there now should fix their own problems. We are spending too much money on this war. We should spend that money on our own problems like poverty. War should not be a long-term plan. We can't say the war is for democracy when we are not helping our own people. It's time to stop the war.

Can I ask a question? I wonder if something happened because someone saw information online. I don't think that's an invasion of privacy. On websites like Myspace, if you share information, many people can see it. You might need to be friends with someone to see their profile. But if you accept them, you give them permission. So, if someone saw that information and it prevented harm, that's good. But it's hard for one person to watch everyone's profiles all day. It's not fair to only look at bad kids. I don't think it's right to have someone's job just look at profiles. It depends on why they saw it. If they were looking for evidence, that's different. I don't have Myspace, but I have a Facebook. It makes me nervous, knowing creepy people can see my information. I've seen TV shows about people finding out a lot about others easily. I don't meet strangers, but people sometimes know my screen name and interests. I limit what I post, but I use it to communicate with friends. It's a tricky issue. I only accept people I know. I don't know if it's a privacy issue, but I'm not sure schools can tell students not to have Myspace.

I talk about Iraq War. I feel bad talking about it. I do not join other people who say they were against it. It does not matter anymore. Now, many people think it was a bad idea. Many countries think this. Eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave. Most American troops there also think this. It was a big mistake. The Middle East is different. We cannot change their culture. We should leave. I do not see a reason to stay. I read that eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave now. They are the people we want to help. We should ask them. If they say yes, we should leave. Then we are not responsible if things happen. We can still help. We will be better than now.

Yes, I feel that gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
It is not just women who face this. Men in certain fields also have trouble.
Women can face a glass ceiling, where they cannot get top jobs even if they are the best qualified.
People may not promote a woman to a position because historically, women are not often in high business positions.
Men who stay at home with children can also face discrimination. Society may think that men should work and make money.
In the fashion industry, some people may not take men seriously if they are interested in fashion.
Sometimes, this can happen because men in fashion have different styles of life.
Depending on the job, there can be discrimination from other men or women.
To change this, it is important to be patient. Women are getting more accepted in business, and stay-at-home dads are also becoming more accepted.
It is important to show the good qualities of people who are stereotyped.
If we push too hard, people will resist change. We have come a long way, and change takes time.
Yes, there can also be discrimination from other men or women depending on the job and where someone grew up.
Sometimes, people may not take someone seriously if they do not speak well.
This is another example of discrimination.

They changed the law. They made it less bad.
Instead of a crime, it is like a traffic ticket.
This means if you get caught, it is not as bad.
It is not like a drug charge that can be bad for jobs.
But, the law change has costs. It costs money to arrest and hold people.
And it costs money to have them in court.
Some places do not want to spend money on this.
But in places like Denver, people think it is good.
They think it can help with money for schools and other programs.
They think it is good because they do not want to have it everywhere.
They think it should not be like cigarettes.
They think it should not be smoked everywhere.
They think it should not be smoked while driving.
They think it is not ok to smoke marijuana in many places.
Some people think alcohol is more bad for driving.
But marijuana can be bad for lifestyle.
Like no two people react the same with substances.
Some people are normal, and some are not.
So, it is hard to talk about substances.
They can have different bad effects.
But they both have bad effects.
No, I do not think so.

I think that many things in the Catholic Church are traditional. This is good because it helps to keep the faith strong.

But, it is also important to be able to change and adapt. Sometimes, the Church's rules seem strict and not accepting of people who are not perfect Catholics or who follow other religions. For example, my parents were not married in the Catholic Church because my dad was an Episcopalian. This is not very tolerant.

The Church teaches us to love others, but then it does not accept them. This can feel hypocritical.

I think it would be good to let priests marry. But, I don't think this would stop them from doing bad things like hurting children. This is because it is a different thing to be married than to hurt children.

I think that priests probably would do bad things whether or not they are married. I don't think allowing them to marry would stop these things from happening.

I do not know if gay marriage should be legal. It is a difficult issue. There are two sides. I do not know which side is correct. But I think this is the most difficult topic we face today. It is close to the issue of separation of church and state. And it is hard to define marriage without hurting someone's feelings.

I think all unions, including gay marriages, should be treated the same as a civil union. The government should not treat them differently. People should not be taxed differently. And the government should not ask what kind of marriage it is.

I think if all states agree, then they should try to make it a federal law. But I do not think a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is a good idea. It is an important issue, but it is not big enough to change the constitution.

I do not think the constitution should be amended to ban gay marriage. It is not important enough. It is my opinion that no.

I was raised in a Christian home. So, the subject of homosexuality is a bit unclear to me. I have many gay friends, but I don’t agree with their lifestyle. I believe it should be legal, but I think each state should decide this, not the president. Well, many states are democratic, and many are republican. Democratic states will likely support gay marriage, and republican states will not. If you live in a democratic state, you know how it feels about this topic. I think each state should decide because they chose to live there. I don’t think homosexuals should have fewer opportunities than heterosexuals, so I believe it should be legalized based on each state’s decision. I also don’t think President Bush should decide this for the whole country. He doesn't live in every state, so he shouldn't decide how each state runs itself. I think some issues should be decided by each state. Plus, he will be out of office soon. If a democratic president wants to lift the ban on gay marriage, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state because they will live with the decision. No, I don't think it should be a national issue.

I do not agree. It is not the place of school officials to look at students' Myspace pages. It is a public thing, and students should expect people to see it. But, if school officials are looking for threats to the school or its students, it is different. They should not look at pages just to catch students. They should look only if they have a reason, like preventing a school shooting. I feel this way because it is important for students to feel safe at school. If officials are just looking for trouble, it is an invasion of privacy. However, if they are looking to keep students safe, it is acceptable. Officials should not go on the internet just to catch students. They should only do it if they have a good reason, like preventing a shooting. I agree with this because it helps to protect the students and make the school a safer place.

The war in Iraq
At first, I supported it because of 9/11
I wished to create as much trouble as they did here
I think we didn't plan well
We were unprepared
It backfired
Now, I don't support it
I don't think it helps
People there fight with each other
They can't fight with us if they fight each other
We should leave
We should not interfere
I don't think they are looking to improve their country
They want us to leave
We should not try to change them
We shouldn't stay there forever
It's not helping
We should leave

transformed_texts: I believe the Catholic Church should change some things. Their old views make people leave. People feel the Church is not accepting. They do not like the Church's views on gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. Some people do not agree with the Church. They think the Church's views are old-fashioned. If the Church changed, it would not lose followers. Some people like the Church, but some do not. They think the Church's views are wrong about these subjects. People do not want to follow something they disagree with. I do not see a reason why priests cannot be married or have female priests. It might not have stopped people from leaving. The Church's rule about priests being married to God is not a good reason. Everyone else can have a job and a family. Priests should be able to do the same. I do not think the Church should be against these things. It should be more accepting.

I am not against same-sex marriage. I believe people are born this way. It is not a choice. Therefore, we should not hold them responsible for their sexual orientation. It is wrong to say one man and one woman can marry but two people of the same sex cannot. The federal government should not interfere. This is not a legal or moral issue. It does not affect our country's security. People are who they are. They should not be punished for being gay.

I think that gay marriage should be legalized because there is no good reason not to. People often think that homosexual couples threaten the heterosexual family, but it is different. There are many aspects to it. It is like two different sides of the same coin. Heads will never be tails, but it is the same thing. There are civil rights involved, such as property taxes and healthcare. If you are in a gay couple, your partner cannot be in the room with you if you are sick or visit you. This is not fair if you spend the rest of your life with someone.

Many scientific studies have been done because it is a hot topic. Homosexual couples have the same success rates and relationship factors as heterosexual couples. It is just a relationship. People worry about adoption issues and community issues, such as how gay couples will affect the community and how children will adjust to society. But parenting skills are the same in gay couples as in straight couples. They can be community involved or not, like heterosexual couples.

The federal government should be very involved in this issue. They should make gay marriage legal in every state. I think the amendment should just be the opposite. But President Bush has strong views about gay marriage. He thinks it goes along with his views on abortion and stem cell research. Most reasons for not allowing gay marriage are moral reasons. Morality differs from person to person. Embracing the morality of one group while ignoring others is unethical. It is hypocritical to create an amendment banning gay marriage based on religious beliefs, especially considering the controversy about under God in the pledge of allegiance.

Some people are against gay marriage because they believe gay people are psychologically damaged. This is not true. The American Psychological Association has said so. People should listen to institutions that do research and studies instead of popular opinion. The world would be seen differently if people did this.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I believe illegal drugs may have benefits. For example, drugs like oxycodone, Vicodin, and Percocet are legal. They help people but are controlled. If we deny benefits just because a drug is illegal, it is not right.

I think marijuana should have the same rules. It should be legal. It is not like drugs like heroin or cocaine. It is not as harmful. We should remove the bad image and use it responsibly. People might use it for medical purposes.

If we make it legal slowly, people can use it responsibly. It should not be all at once. That would cause abuse. But first, we should remove the bad image around marijuana.

The church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. As a child, I always went to church on Sundays. I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, church is more casual. People wear jeans or khakis. Some even come in beach clothes from the beach. Families are often late. Church has become more flexible. People wear casual clothes. I do not know the politics of the church. It is not my main concern. Regarding accusations against Catholic priests, these could not have been prevented by allowing female priests or married priests. Some married men commit this crime. It is not about being married or not. Priests choose their path. Other religions allow priests to marry. If priests want to marry and practice their faith, they should consider other religions.

I was okay with the idea at first, but the Iraq War was soon after September 11th. The Bush administration said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. This was not true. They lied to the American people. This is bad. Colin Powell, who gave a big speech about this at the UN, now says he did not believe what he said.

The Bush administration did not care about the constitution. They went to war to get revenge and to get oil. This is wrong. They should not lie to people.

Now, people say the war can end soon. But this may cause a civil war. This is bad. The UN and some other countries suggest a coalition can help. But this may cause more problems.

Many people in Iraq still have different ideas. The government is not working well. The new Prime Minister has little control. This is causing friction and fighting.

I talk about the Iraq War.
It's not a declared war. It started after the 9/11 attacks.
Some people think it's not a good idea to keep fighting.
They say we want oil and democracy.
But it's hard to build democracy in one day.
If we leave, they might be angry.
I don't know much about the war.
I don't like to talk about it.
I think it's better to help them and then leave.
Maybe it will be better for everyone.
I don't know how long it will last.
I'm sorry if I don't help.

I am not sure it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says separation of church and state. It is clear to me that this is a religious issue and should be decided by churches, not the government.

Many people believe this is against their religion. For example, most Catholics and Christians do not support it. Trying to make it illegal would be like one church's belief over another.

Separation of church and state is very important. It lets people follow different religions. Making an amendment about it would not be correct. It would go against what is already in the constitution.

I do not think the federal government or any government should be involved. The president is trying to make this amendment because he is Catholic and has his own beliefs.

It is up to the churches to decide this. The government should not interfere. There is no good reason to make an amendment banning it. It might even help society.

I have said all that I want to say.

Before the war in Iraq began, the government did not tell the truth about the reasons for war. They said the war was to stop terrorism after the September 11th attacks. But this was not true. The war had little to do with the attacks. The government wanted people to be angry about the attacks and support the war.
I do not like war, especially preemptive strikes. The war in Iraq was like the Vietnam War. Many soldiers died. The American government did not plan well for after removing Iraq's government. They did not know what would happen next.
The United States took away Iraq's government and tried to give them a new one. This is like what happened in Vietnam. It will take a long time for democracy to succeed. The American government did not plan well for this.
The war started in 2003 and it is still going on. Many American soldiers are still dying. The Iraqis need time to learn to govern themselves. It will take years. The American government should have known this.
In the 2004 election, I planned to vote for George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to leave Iraq now. We took their government away. We cannot abandon them. But it is also hard to keep risking American lives.
The war started for many reasons. Iraq has oil, which is important for money. The government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but they were not found. Other countries with these weapons are not attacked. The government is not being fair or truthful.
I hope the war ends soon. But I think it will not happen quickly.

I believe gay marriage is a personal choice. It is a matter of people's rights, not something to control. I think it is unfair to take away rights because of something people cannot control. It is not humane. I have always supported gay marriage. I think it is not right for politics or the government to decide this. It is a personal and household issue, not a public one. In my neighborhood, there are two or three gay couples. They live and act like any other family. I think it is ridiculous for President Bush to try to decide how to interpret marriage. He should not decide what people can or cannot do. I think it is not fair that two men or two women wanting to get married are treated differently. I think it should be a private matter. I have read that being gay can be biological, not something influenced by society. I believe this because I have heard from many sources. I think it is unfair that gay people are treated differently. They should have the same rights as everyone else. I think it is not right for the government to decide who can or cannot get married. It should be a personal choice. I think it is unfair that gay people are treated differently than others. They should have the same rights as everyone else.

I put things on the internet. It is public. Many people can see it. As an R.A., I must deal with this. When you put something on the internet, it can change how people think about you. You cannot say things about hurting others. The internet is seen by everyone. If your friend on Myspace sees something, the school will know too. If something serious happens, the school must act. But they do not know what to take seriously. Some people joke about serious things. Schools must check social media if they think a student is dangerous. They cannot invade privacy by looking at private messages. But if a student comes to school, they can check social media. Teachers should not make fake accounts and friend students. I do not want to see my residents' internet pictures if they drink. I do not want to be connected to them on Facebook. It is not my job to monitor their internet use.

The war has lasted too long. The purpose was good at first—to restore democracy. But now, we do it to show we are a strong country. We started the war to overthrow Saddam Hussein, but there were also old problems between his father and George's father. I think our purpose got lost. We should have stopped after a few months. The government there now should fix their own problems. We are spending too much money on this war. We should spend that money on our own problems like poverty. War should not be a long-term plan. We can't say the war is for democracy when we are not helping our own people. It's time to stop the war.

Can I ask a question? I wonder if something happened because someone saw information online. I don't think that's an invasion of privacy. On websites like Myspace, if you share information, many people can see it. You might need to be friends with someone to see their profile. But if you accept them, you give them permission. So, if someone saw that information and it prevented harm, that's good. But it's hard for one person to watch everyone's profiles all day. It's not fair to only look at bad kids. I don't think it's right to have someone's job just look at profiles. It depends on why they saw it. If they were looking for evidence, that's different. I don't have Myspace, but I have a Facebook. It makes me nervous, knowing creepy people can see my information. I've seen TV shows about people finding out a lot about others easily. I don't meet strangers, but people sometimes know my screen name and interests. I limit what I post, but I use it to communicate with friends. It's a tricky issue. I only accept people I know. I don't know if it's a privacy issue, but I'm not sure schools can tell students not to have Myspace.

I talk about Iraq War. I feel bad talking about it. I do not join other people who say they were against it. It does not matter anymore. Now, many people think it was a bad idea. Many countries think this. Eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave. Most American troops there also think this. It was a big mistake. The Middle East is different. We cannot change their culture. We should leave. I do not see a reason to stay. I read that eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave now. They are the people we want to help. We should ask them. If they say yes, we should leave. Then we are not responsible if things happen. We can still help. We will be better than now.

Yes, I feel that gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
It is not just women who face this. Men in certain fields also have trouble.
Women can face a glass ceiling, where they cannot get top jobs even if they are the best qualified.
People may not promote a woman to a position because historically, women are not often in high business positions.
Men who stay at home with children can also face discrimination. Society may think that men should work and make money.
In the fashion industry, some people may not take men seriously if they are interested in fashion.
Sometimes, this can happen because men in fashion have different styles of life.
Depending on the job, there can be discrimination from other men or women.
To change this, it is important to be patient. Women are getting more accepted in business, and stay-at-home dads are also becoming more accepted.
It is important to show the good qualities of people who are stereotyped.
If we push too hard, people will resist change. We have come a long way, and change takes time.
Yes, there can also be discrimination from other men or women depending on the job and where someone grew up.
Sometimes, people may not take someone seriously if they do not speak well.
This is another example of discrimination.

They changed the law. They made it less bad.
Instead of a crime, it is like a traffic ticket.
This means if you get caught, it is not as bad.
It is not like a drug charge that can be bad for jobs.
But, the law change has costs. It costs money to arrest and hold people.
And it costs money to have them in court.
Some places do not want to spend money on this.
But in places like Denver, people think it is good.
They think it can help with money for schools and other programs.
They think it is good because they do not want to have it everywhere.

I think that many things in the Catholic Church are traditional. This is good because it helps to keep the faith strong.

But, it is also important to be able to change and adapt. Sometimes, the Church's rules seem strict and not accepting of people who are not perfect Catholics or who follow other religions. For example, my parents were not married in the Catholic Church because my dad was an Episcopalian. This is not very tolerant.

The Church teaches us to love others, but then it does not accept them. This can feel hypocritical.

I think it would be good to let priests marry. But, I don't think this would stop them from doing bad things like hurting children. This is because it is a different thing to be married than to hurt children.

I think that priests probably would do bad things whether or not they are married. I don't think allowing them to marry would stop these things from happening.

I do not know if gay marriage should be legal. It is a difficult issue. There are two sides. I do not know which side is correct. But I think this is the most difficult topic we face today. It is close to the issue of separation of church and state. And it is hard to define marriage without hurting someone's feelings.

I think all unions, including gay marriages, should be treated the same as a civil union. The government should not treat them differently. People should not be taxed differently. And the government should not ask what kind of marriage it is.

I think if all states agree, then they should try to make it a federal law. But I do not think a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is a good idea. It is an important issue, but it is not big enough to change the constitution.

I do not think the constitution should be amended to ban gay marriage. It is not important enough. It is my opinion that no.

I was raised in a Christian home. So, the subject of homosexuality is a bit unclear to me. I have many gay friends, but I don’t agree with their lifestyle. I believe it should be legal, but I think each state should decide this, not the president. Well, many states are democratic, and many are republican. Democratic states will likely support gay marriage, and republican states will not. If you live in a democratic state, you know how it feels about this topic. I think each state should decide because they chose to live there. I don’t think homosexuals should have fewer opportunities than heterosexuals, so I believe it should be legalized based on each state’s decision. I also don’t think President Bush should decide this for the whole country. He doesn't live in every state, so he shouldn't decide how each state runs itself. I think some issues should be decided by each state. Plus, he will be out of office soon. If a democratic president wants to lift the ban on gay marriage, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state because they will live with the decision. No, I don't think it should be a national issue.

I do not agree. It is not the place of school officials to look at students' Myspace pages. It is a public thing, and students should expect people to see it. But, if school officials are looking for threats to the school or its students, it is different. They should not look at pages just to catch students. They should look only if they have a reason, like preventing a school shooting. I feel this way because it is important for students to feel safe at school. If officials are just looking for trouble, it is an invasion of privacy. However, if they are looking to keep students safe, it is acceptable. Officials should not go on the internet just to catch students. They should only do it if they have a good reason, like preventing a shooting. I agree with this because it helps to protect the students and make the school a safer place.

They want us to leave
We should not try to change them
We shouldn't stay there forever
It's not helping
We should leave

transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some things.
The Church is losing followers because it is not accepting of many things.
The Church has strong views about gay marriage, abortion, and birth control, but these views are old-fashioned.
If the Church changes to accept new ideas, it will not lose followers.
Many people are leaving the Church because they disagree with its views on these subjects.
The Church is against abortion, so people who support it will not follow the Church.
People also disagree with the Church's views on gay marriage.
The Church should allow female priests and married priests.
This would not prevent people from leaving the Church.
Priests are devoted to God, but they can also have a family life like everyone else.

I am not against gay marriage. Everyone should be free to marry whom they love. It is not a choice that people make. They are born that way. So, it is not fair to say that a man and woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. I do not think the federal government should get involved. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is just about who people are. They should not be punished for being gay. That is how they were born. It is not their fault. The federal government should not interfere in people's lives. It is not their responsibility to decide who can or cannot marry.

I believe that gay marriage should be legalized. It's important. Many people think that homosexual couples threaten the heterosexual family. But this is not true. Gay marriage is different. It is like two different sides of the same coin. Heads and tails are the same in many ways. Gay couples have the same rights as heterosexual couples. They should be able to get married and have the same legal protections.

Many people worry about adoption and how children will adjust. However, studies show that children of gay couples are just as healthy and happy as children of heterosexual couples. The main problem is how others treat them in society.

The government should make gay marriage legal in all states. The amendment against it is not fair. It is like segregation. It treats people differently based on their sexual orientation. This is not right.

President Bush has strong views against gay marriage. He believes it is a moral issue. But morality is not the same for everyone. Some people's beliefs should not be used to make laws for everyone.

Many people are against gay marriage because they believe it is a sign of psychological damage. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says this is not true. People should listen to studies and experts, not just friends and neighbors.

I work at a hospital pharmacy this summer. Sometimes, people think drugs are bad just because they are illegal. I say, just because a drug is illegal does not mean it is not useful for medicine. Some drugs, like oxycodone, are illegal but doctors use them because they help people. Marijuana is like this. Many people think it is bad, but it is not like drugs like heroin or cocaine. I think we should look at marijuana differently. If we remove the bad image of it, people might use it responsibly. Then, if we make it legal, it could be helpful.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was younger, I always went to church every Sunday. I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, the church has a teenager mass that is only thirty minutes long. People wear casual clothes, even beach clothes in summer. Sometimes, people are late. They wear jeans and khakis. I do not know the politics of the church, but this is what I have noticed.

Regarding the accusations against Catholic priests dealing with pedophilia, I do not think these could have been prevented by changing the church. Men can be married and still become pedophiles. I think this is a genetics issue, not something the church can fix. Even if priests were allowed to get married, it would not change them. They could become pedophiles anyway. They chose to be priests. There are religions where priests can get married, like in Seventh Heaven. If they want to practice their faith and get married, they should consider another religion. The church could not have prevented this from happening if they did not know. If they tried to cover it up, that is shameful. But I do not think they always knew. That is all I have to say about the Catholic church.

I thought the idea was okay, but many people were still upset about the September 11th attacks. The Bush administration used the Iraq war to catch Osama Bin Laden. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction, but this was not true. This made me very angry.

The Bush administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who gave a big presentation at the UN, said he was not convinced by the evidence. This is like a crime, and it should be an impeachable offense.

I think the Bush administration does not care about the constitution. They want to go to war. I think they also want to get more oil. The Secretary of the Treasury said this in his book. The younger Bush was angry about his dad's administration. He wanted revenge against Saddam Hussein.

I think the war has been going on for too long. If we leave now, there will be a civil war. Many more people will die. The UN and the United States are making a new plan. They want other countries to help. But this may cause more problems. The interim government is not working well. The Prime Minister cannot control the political process. Radical groups want to control the government. Many people are fighting for control.

I cannot say more about this topic in polite company.

I talk about the War in Iraq. I not know much about. I think it not declared war. I think we just want to make sure Iraq not do bad things. I think we want oil too. But I think no reason to stay there. We try to make democracy, but it take long time. If we leave, Iraq people not happy. We make it worse. I think stay there bad for Bush. It make him look bad. I think we should stop war. But I think we should help them. I think we should not stay there forever. I think it cause more problems. I think people in Iraq have lives too. I think we should help them, but not try to change them. I think it cause more problems. It take long time. I think we should think about it more. That's all.

I think it is not right for a state to make it illegal or for the government to decide this.
The constitution says churches and government should not control each other.
Trying to make it illegal would break this rule.
Most Catholics are against it, but the government should not decide for the churches.
The constitution already has rules about this.
Making a new rule about it would not be right.
I do not think the government should get involved in this.
This is about the person's personal beliefs, not about the economy or society.
The government should let the churches decide.

I think the government was not honest about the war in Iraq. This was a wrong decision. The government said Iraq was linked with the September 11 attacks. This was not true. The government wanted to make people angry about these attacks and so they invaded Iraq in 2003.

I am against war, especially when it is not needed. The government should have been ready for what happened after the war. Many soldiers died. The government did not plan well for this. The US removed the Iraqi government and tried to create a new one. This is like in Vietnam, where the US tried to stop communism.

I think the government should never have started the war. If you go to war, you need to be ready for all possibilities. The government was not ready for the chaos after the war. Many American soldiers are still dying. It is a long process to make a new government work. In our own country, making democracy took a long time.

The US government made people think it would be easy to make Iraq democratic. This is not true. It will take a long time. We should not try to make other countries democratic if we are not ready.

I think the government should finish what they started. But we are risking too many lives. We should think about how much is too much. The war in Iraq has lasted so long. We took away the Iraqi government and their way of life. We cannot just abandon them now.

The war started because of oil. The US wanted to control the oil in Iraq. The government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. This was not true. Other countries with weapons of mass destruction were not attacked. The government is not being honest about its decisions.

I hope the war will end soon. But I do not think it will end soon. I hope for peace in Iraq soon. But probably not.

I support gay marriage. I always have. I think it is a personal choice, not something to decide for others. It is now proven that it can be biological, not just sociological. It is not fair to take away rights from people who cannot control this.

Gay couples function like any other family. In my neighborhood, there are a few openly gay couples. They walk their dogs and live just like anyone else. I do not think it should be a political issue. It is a personal matter. I think it is unfair that straight couples can marry secretly, but gay couples cannot, even if they want to.

I have read and heard that being gay can be a natural part of being human. It is not something people choose or develop. I think marriage should be a private matter, not a public one.

I do not think it is fair that two people who love each other cannot marry just because of their gender.

When you put things on the internet, it is public. Many people see it. Be careful what you write. It can affect people's opinions of you.

If you write about dangerous things, like blowing things up or shootings, people might think you are serious. This can lead to problems. For example, someone might call the police. They can't ignore this because something could happen.

Sometimes, people might write about these things as a joke. But the situation can become serious. School officials need to check if something is serious. If they find something dangerous, they must act.

If you don't want something to be seen, don't put it on the internet. If you want to keep private, don't share it online.

School officials can't check everything on the internet. They can't look at everyone's Facebook or Myspace. But if someone brings them information, they must take it seriously. They must check if there is danger.

Teachers should not create fake accounts to friend students. This is not fair. They shouldn't look at students' private lives. If a student shares something dangerous, the school must act.

Putting things on the internet is a big responsibility. Be careful what you share.

I believe the war has lasted too long. It started with good intentions—to restore democracy. But now, I feel like we have lost our purpose. Maybe the original reasons were not entirely fair. For example, George Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein before. The war might have been started to prove we are a powerful country. Our goal was good at first, but now it seems like we are fighting just to fight. I think we should stop. The Iraqi government should take care of itself. We have been fighting for too long, and it is not good for our economy. We should use our money to fix our own problems, like poverty and healthcare. We should not keep fighting just to fight. It is time to stop.

I have a question. Can I ask about something?
I think I understand how it was prevented. Someone looked at a profile online and saw something.
That's okay. If you put information on the internet, other people can see it.
On Myspace, you have to be a friend to see someone's profile. But you agreed to be their friend, so they can see it.
If you post information, you know many people will see it.
If someone sees something bad and prevents a problem, it's good.
But it's hard to have one person look at everyone's profiles.
That would be unfair.
I don't have Myspace, but I have Facebook. I worry about creepy people seeing my info.
I saw a show about a man who found a girl's screen name quickly and talked with her.
I don't like that. But sometimes, I get messages from people I don't know.
They know my interests, where I am, and my friends.
I try to put up only safe info, but I like to communicate with friends.
It's hard to balance privacy and safety.
I only let my friends see my profile.
But I don't know who else can look.
My roommate's high school banned Myspace. I don't know if that was right.
How did high school officials decide this?
I don't know if that's a privacy issue, but it's unclear why they banned it.
That's all I can think of.

The Iraq War is a complicated subject. I start by saying, "Hmm, I only have this and one more thing to talk about it. I feel hypocritical talking about it. I hate to join the bandwagon of people who say they were against it from the start. But, it's not important anymore.

The general consensus is that the war was a bad idea. Polls show that 75-80% of the world thinks it was a bad idea. 80% of Iraqis and 70% of U.S. troops think it was a dumb idea. They think we should pull out within a year.

The war started before we went in. It is still a disaster. Pulling out will also be a disaster. It's hard to make good decisions in the Middle East.

The culture of the Middle East is very different from ours. The U.S. and previous administrations think we can bring democracy where it shouldn't exist. This is a big mistake. Saddam was a bad leader, but we should consider the pros and cons before invading.

The war is like quicksand. We don't know what to say about it. I don't see a reason to stay. The administration might have hopeful ideas, but I haven't heard a good reason to stay longer.

I read that 80% of Iraqis want us to leave within a year, and 25% want us to leave now. We should ask them what to do.

If we ask and they say to leave, we can say we tried to help, but they decided not to. We can be the good guys if we help later.

We might never be the good guys in the Middle East, but it will be better than staying now.

Gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It affects many fields of work and not only women. For example, men in certain fields, like fashion, may face discrimination because people do not take them seriously.

Men who stay at home with children also face discrimination. People may look down on them because society expects men to be breadwinners. In contrast, women are often expected to be the primary caregivers for children.

Even in the business world, women still face the glass ceiling. Many women qualify for high-level positions, but they are not promoted because of their gender.

Slowly, society is changing. Women are becoming CEOs and more accepted in the business world. Men who stay at home are also being accepted more. People are learning that a woman can have the better job and a man can stay at home.

In fashion, men are starting to be taken more seriously. They are learning to listen to their female friends and wives about fashion.

Discrimination also happens between men of different backgrounds. A man from a farm with good intelligence but poor grammar might be looked down upon in a CEO job. People might question his intelligence because of his grammar.

This is about marijuana. People did not make it legal. They made it less bad. They changed it from a big crime to a small ticket. If someone gets a ticket, it might affect jobs. It might make people think bad things about the person. In some places, it costs a lot to arrest and punish people. Some places do not want to do this. Denver is good with this. They spend money on schools and social programs. Marijuana is not good if it is everywhere. It is not like cigarettes, which can be bought in stores. People might smoke it in cars. It is bad in our society. Alcohol is worse for driving, but marijuana can change a person's life. People react to substances differently. Some can use it and others cannot.

I say yes.
Many things in the Catholic Church are traditional and good. But it is also important to change when needed.
Some Catholics go to church every week. They follow the rules closely. They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. This is not fair and not kind.
My parents faced this problem. My dad was an Episcopalian. My mom was Catholic. They did not marry in the Catholic Church. This was not right.
The church teaches to love others. But it does not always do this in practice. This is not fair.
I think priests should be allowed to marry. But I do not think this would stop pedophilic behavior. It is a different problem.
People who hurt children might do this even if priests were married. This is a different issue.
So, I think priests should be allowed to marry. But this would not stop the bad behavior.

I have not decided yet. This topic is difficult. It is close to the separation of church and state. It is also about how to define marriage. This is tricky. I do not know if either side is right or wrong.

I think all civil unions should be equal. If two people are together, they should be treated the same. Marriage should not be defined by the government. People should not get tax breaks just for being married.

If all states agree, they should make it federal law. But a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not necessary. It is not important enough to change the constitution for this reason.

I was raised in a Christian home. Homosexuality is a complicated issue for me because I have many gay friends. I do not agree with the lifestyle, but I think it should be legalized. I believe each state should decide, not the president. Democratic states will likely legalize it, but I do not disagree if a state chooses to do so. The president should not decide for the whole country. I do not feel Bush should ban gay marriage. He does not live in every state, and his decision will not affect how states want to run themselves. I think some issues should be decided by each state. Plus, he will be out of office in two years. A new president may lift the ban, and it will just change back and forth. I think states should make their own decisions because they live with the results, not the president.

I do not agree with the idea of school officials using Myspace to catch students. It is a public site where students post for others to see. If they go on to check for students doing wrong things, like drinking or smoking, it is like spying. This is an invasion of privacy. However, if they use it to make the school safer, like to prevent school shootings, it is okay. School officials should not use it just to catch students. But if they find something that can make the school safer, they should use it. These officials are just doing their job to make the school a better and safer place for everyone. This is similar to what happens in our school. We practice lock downs to be safe from terrorists. We do this to protect students. The school officials are just doing the same. They are making sure students are safe. They are not invading privacy. They are making the school a safer place. That is their job.

War in Iraq
I was all for it at first because of 9/11, but I changed my mind. I think we went over there unprepared and without a plan. We should have thought about the long-term effects. I wanted revenge, but now I think we should leave. I don’t think Iraqis will ever change.

I don’t think they care about rebuilding their country. They just want us to go away. We should have a better plan and more unity. We were emotional and angry when we went there. We created more chaos than we fixed. I think the people in Iraq will always fight each other. We are not making enough progress. We should leave. We can’t stay there forever. transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some things.
The Church is losing followers because it is not accepting of many things.
The Church has strong views about gay marriage, abortion, and birth control, but these views are old-fashioned.
If the Church changes to accept new ideas, it will not lose followers.
Many people are leaving the Church because they disagree with its views on these subjects.
The Church is against abortion, so people who support it will not follow the Church.
People also disagree with the Church's views on gay marriage.
The Church should allow female priests and married priests.
This would not prevent people from leaving the Church.
Priests are devoted to God, but they can also have a family life like everyone else.

I am not against gay marriage. Everyone should be free to marry whom they love. It is not a choice that people make. They are born that way. So, it is not fair to say that a man and woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. I do not think the federal government should get involved. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is just about who people are. They should not be punished for being gay. That is how they were born. It is not their fault. The federal government should not interfere in people's lives. It is not their responsibility to decide who can or cannot marry.

I believe that gay marriage should be legalized. It's important. Many people think that homosexual couples threaten the heterosexual family. But this is not true. Gay marriage is different. It is like two different sides of the same coin. Heads and tails are the same in many ways. Gay couples have the same rights as heterosexual couples. They should be able to get married and have the same legal protections.

Many people worry about adoption and how children will adjust. However, studies show that children of gay couples are just as healthy and happy as children of heterosexual couples. The main problem is how others treat them in society.

The government should make gay marriage legal in all states. The amendment against it is not fair. It is like segregation. It treats people differently based on their sexual orientation. This is not right.

President Bush has strong views against gay marriage. He believes it is a moral issue. But morality is not the same for everyone. Some people's beliefs should not be used to make laws for everyone.

Many people are against gay marriage because they believe it is a sign of psychological damage. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says this is not true. People should listen to studies and experts, not just friends and neighbors.

I work at a hospital pharmacy this summer. Sometimes, people think drugs are bad just because they are illegal. I say, just because a drug is illegal does not mean it is not useful for medicine. Some drugs, like oxycodone, are illegal but doctors use them because they help people. Marijuana is like this. Many people think it is bad, but it is not like drugs like heroin or cocaine. I think we should look at marijuana differently. If we remove the bad image of it, people might use it responsibly. Then, if we make it legal, it could be helpful.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was younger, I always went to church every Sunday. I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, the church has a teenager mass that is only thirty minutes long. People wear casual clothes, even beach clothes in summer. Sometimes, people are late. They wear jeans and khakis. I do not know the politics of the church, but this is what I have noticed.

Regarding the accusations against Catholic priests dealing with pedophilia, I do not think these could have been prevented by changing the church. Men can be married and still become pedophiles. I think this is a genetics issue, not something the church can fix. Even if priests were allowed to get married, it would not change them. They could become pedophiles anyway. They chose to be priests. There are religions where priests can get married, like in Seventh Heaven. If they want to practice their faith and get married, they should consider another religion. The church could not have prevented this from happening if they did not know. If they tried to cover it up, that is shameful. But I do not think they always knew. That is all I have to say about the Catholic church.

I thought the idea was okay, but many people were still upset about the September 11th attacks. The Bush administration used the Iraq war to catch Osama Bin Laden. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction, but this was not true. This made me very angry.

The Bush administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who gave a big presentation at the UN, said he was not convinced by the evidence. This is like a crime, and it should be an impeachable offense.

I think the Bush administration does not care about the constitution. They want to go to war. I think they also want to get more oil. The Secretary of the Treasury said this in his book. The younger Bush was angry about his dad's administration. He wanted revenge against Saddam Hussein.

I think the war has been going on for too long. If we leave now, there will be a civil war. Many more people will die. The UN and the United States are making a new plan. They want other countries to help. But this may cause more problems. The interim government is not working well. The Prime Minister cannot control the political process. Radical groups want to control the government. Many people are fighting for control.

I cannot say more about this topic in polite company.

I talk about the War in Iraq. I not know much about. I think it not declared war. I think we just want to make sure Iraq not do bad things. I think we want oil too. But I think no reason to stay there. We try to make democracy, but it take long time. If we leave, Iraq people not happy. We make it worse. I think stay there bad for Bush. It make him look bad. I think we should stop war. But I think we should help them. I think we should not stay there forever. I think it cause more problems. I think people in Iraq have lives too. I think we should help them, but not try to change them. I think it cause more problems. It take long time. I think we should think about it more. That's all.

I think it is not right for a state to make it illegal or for the government to decide this.
The constitution says churches and government should not control each other.
Trying to make it illegal would break this rule.
Most Catholics are against it, but the government should not decide for the churches.
The constitution already has rules about this.
Making a new rule about it would not be right.
I do not think the government should get involved in this.
This is about the person's personal beliefs, not about the economy or society.
The government should let the churches decide.

I think the government was not honest about the war in Iraq. This was a wrong decision. The government said Iraq was linked with the September 11 attacks. This was not true. The government wanted to make people angry about these attacks and so they invaded Iraq in 2003.

I am against war, especially when it is not needed. The government should have been ready for what happened after the war. Many soldiers died. The government did not plan well for this. The US removed the Iraqi government and tried to create a new one. This is like in Vietnam, where the US tried to stop communism.

I think the government should never have started the war. If you go to war, you need to be ready for all possibilities. The government was not ready for the chaos after the war. Many American soldiers are still dying. It is a long process to make a new government work. In our own country, making democracy took a long time.

The US government made people think it would be easy to make Iraq democratic. This is not true. It will take a long time. We should not try to make other countries democratic if we are not ready.

I think the government should finish what they started. But we are risking too many lives. We should think about how much is too much. The war in Iraq has lasted so long. We took away the Iraqi government and their way of life. We cannot just abandon them now.

The war started because of oil. The US wanted to control the oil in Iraq. The government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. This was not true. Other countries with weapons of mass destruction were not attacked. The government is not being honest about its decisions.

I hope the war will end soon. But I do not think it will end soon. I hope for peace in Iraq soon. But probably not.

I support gay marriage. I always have. I think it is a personal choice, not something to decide for others. It is now proven that it can be biological, not just sociological. It is not fair to take away rights from people who cannot control this.

Gay couples function like any other family. In my neighborhood, there are a few openly gay couples. They walk their dogs and live just like anyone else. I do not think it should be a political issue. It is a personal matter. I think it is unfair that straight couples can marry secretly, but gay couples cannot, even if they want to.

I have read and heard that being gay can be a natural part of being human. It is not something people choose or develop. I think marriage should be a private matter, not a public one.

I do not think it is fair that two people who love each other cannot marry just because of their gender.

When you put things on the internet, it is public. Many people see it. Be careful what you write. It can affect people's opinions of you.

If you write about dangerous things, like blowing things up or shootings, people might think you are serious. This can lead to problems. For example, someone might call the police. They can't ignore this because something could happen.

Sometimes, people might write about these things as a joke. But the situation can become serious. School officials need to check if something is serious. If they find something dangerous, they must act.

If you don't want something to be seen, don't put it on the internet. If you want to keep private, don't share it online.

School officials can't check everything on the internet. They can't look at everyone's Facebook or Myspace. But if someone brings them information, they must take it seriously. They must check if there is danger.

Teachers should not create fake accounts to friend students. This is not fair. They shouldn't look at students' private lives. If a student shares something dangerous, the school must act.

Putting things on the internet is a big responsibility. Be careful what you share.

I believe the war has lasted too long. It started with good intentions—to restore democracy. But now, I feel like we have lost our purpose. Maybe the original reasons were not entirely fair. For example, George Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein before. The war might have been started to prove we are a powerful country. Our goal was good at first, but now it seems like we are fighting just to fight. I think we should stop. The Iraqi government should take care of itself. We have been fighting for too long, and it is not good for our economy. We should use our money to fix our own problems, like poverty and healthcare. We should not keep fighting just to fight. It is time to stop.

I have a question. Can I ask about something?
I think I understand how it was prevented. Someone looked at a profile online and saw something.
That's okay. If you put information on the internet, other people can see it.
On Myspace, you have to be a friend to see someone's profile. But you agreed to be their friend, so they can see it.
If you post information, you know many people will see it.
If someone sees something bad and prevents a problem, it's good.
But it's hard to have one person look at everyone's profiles.
That would be unfair.
I don't have Myspace, but I have Facebook. I worry about creepy people seeing my info.
I saw a show about a man who found a girl's screen name quickly and talked with her.
I don't like that. But sometimes, I get messages from people I don't know.
They know my interests, where I am, and my friends.
I try to put up only safe info, but I like to communicate with friends.
It's hard to balance privacy and safety.
I only let my friends see my profile.
But I don't know who else can look.
My roommate's high school banned Myspace. I don't know if that was right.
How did high school officials decide this?
I don't know if that's a privacy issue, but it's unclear why they banned it.
That's all I can think of.

The Iraq War is a complicated subject. I start by saying, "Hmm, I only have this and one more thing to talk about it. I feel hypocritical talking about it. I hate to join the bandwagon of people who say they were against it from the start. But, it's not important anymore.

The general consensus is that the war was a bad idea. Polls show that 75-80% of the world thinks it was a bad idea. 80% of Iraqis and 70% of U.S. troops think it was a dumb idea. They think we should pull out within a year.

The war started before we went in. It is still a disaster. Pulling out will also be a disaster. It's hard to make good decisions in the Middle East.

The culture of the Middle East is very different from ours. The U.S. and previous administrations think we can bring democracy where it shouldn't exist. This is a big mistake. Saddam was a bad leader, but we should consider the pros and cons before invading.

The war is like quicksand. We don't know what to say about it. I don't see a reason to stay. The administration might have hopeful ideas, but I haven't heard a good reason to stay longer.

I read that 80% of Iraqis want us to leave within a year, and 25% want us to leave now. We should ask them what to do.

If we ask and they say to leave, we can say we tried to help, but they decided not to. We can be the good guys if we help later.

We might never be the good guys in the Middle East, but it will be better than staying now.

Gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It affects many fields of work and not only women. For example, men in certain fields, like fashion, may face discrimination because people do not take them seriously.

Men who stay at home with children also face discrimination. People may look down on them because society expects men to be breadwinners. In contrast, women are often expected to be the primary caregivers for children.

Even in the business world, women still face the glass ceiling. Many women qualify for high-level positions, but they are not promoted because of their gender.

Slowly, society is changing. Women are becoming CEOs and more accepted in the business world. Men who stay at home are also being accepted more. People are learning that a woman can have the better job and a man can stay at home.

In fashion, men are starting to be taken more seriously. They are learning to listen to their female friends and wives about fashion.

Discrimination also happens between men of different backgrounds. A man from a farm with good intelligence but poor grammar might be looked down upon in a CEO job. People might question his intelligence because of his grammar.

This is about marijuana. People did not make it legal. They made it less bad. They changed it from a big crime to a small ticket. If someone gets a ticket, it might affect jobs. It might make people think bad things about the person. In some places, it costs a lot to arrest and punish people. Some places do not want to do this. Denver is good with this. They spend money on schools and social programs. Marijuana is not good if it is everywhere. It is not like cigarettes, which can be bought in stores. People might smoke it in cars. It is bad in our society. Alcohol is worse for driving, but marijuana can change a person's life. People react to substances differently. Some can use it and others cannot.

I say yes.
Many things in the Catholic Church are traditional and good. But it is also important to change when needed.
Some Catholics go to church every week. They follow the rules closely. They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. This is not fair and not kind.
My parents faced this problem. My dad was an Episcopalian. My mom was Catholic. They did not marry in the Catholic Church. This was not right.
The church teaches to love others. But it does not always do this in practice. This is not fair.
I think priests should be allowed to marry. But I do not think this would stop pedophilic behavior. It is a different problem.
People who hurt children might do this even if priests were married. This is a different issue.
So, I think priests should be allowed to marry. But this would not stop the bad behavior.

I have not decided yet. This topic is difficult. It is close to the separation of church and state. It is also about how to define marriage. This is tricky. I do not know if either side is right or wrong.

I think all civil unions should be equal. If two people are together, they should be treated the same. Marriage should not be defined by the government. People should not get tax breaks just for being married.

If all states agree, they should make it federal law. But a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not necessary. It is not important enough to change the constitution for this reason.

I was raised in a Christian home. Homosexuality is a complicated issue for me because I have many gay friends. I do not agree with the lifestyle, but I think it should be legalized. I believe each state should decide, not the president. Democratic states will likely legalize it, but I do not disagree if a state chooses to do so. The president should not decide for the whole country. I do not feel Bush should ban gay marriage. He does not live in every state, and his decision will not affect how states want to run themselves. I think some issues should be decided by each state. Plus, he will be out of office in two years. A new president may lift the ban, and it will just change back and forth. I think states should make their own decisions because they live with the results, not the president.

I do not agree with the idea of school officials using Myspace to catch students. It is a public site where students post for others to see. If they go on to check for students doing wrong things, like drinking or smoking, it is like spying. This is an invasion of privacy. However, if they use it to make the school safer, like to prevent school shootings, it is okay. School officials should not use it just to catch students. But if they find something that can make the school safer, they should use it. These officials are just doing their job to make the school a better and safer place for everyone. This is similar to what happens in our school. We practice lock downs to be safe from terrorists. We do this to protect students. The school officials are just doing the same. They are making sure students are safe. They are not invading privacy. They are making the school a safer place. That is their job.

War in Iraq
I was all for it at first because of 9/11, but I changed my mind. I think we went over there unprepared and without a plan. We should have thought about the long-term effects. I wanted revenge, but now I think we should leave. I don’t think Iraqis will ever change.

I don’t think they care about rebuilding their country. They just want us to go away. We should have a better plan and more unity. We were emotional and angry when we went there. We created more chaos than we fixed. I think the people in Iraq will always fight each other. We are not making enough progress. We should leave. We can’t stay there forever. It is hurting us more than it is helping.
