transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some things.
The Church is losing followers because it is not accepting of many things.
The Church has strong views about gay marriage, abortion, and birth control, but these views are old-fashioned.
If the Church changes to accept new ideas, it will not lose followers.
Many people are leaving the Church because they disagree with its views on these subjects.
The Church is against abortion, so people who support it will not follow the Church.
People also disagree with the Church's views on gay marriage.
The Church should allow female priests and married priests.
This would not prevent people from leaving the Church.
Priests are devoted to God, but they can also have a family life like everyone else.

I am not against gay marriage. Everyone should be free to marry whom they love. It is not a choice that people make. They are born that way. So, it is not fair to say that a man and woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. I do not think the federal government should get involved. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is just about who people are. They should not be punished for being gay. That is how they were born. It is not their fault. The federal government should not interfere in people's lives. It is not their responsibility to decide who can or cannot marry.

I believe that gay marriage should be legalized. It's important. Many people think that homosexual couples threaten the heterosexual family. But this is not true. Gay marriage is different. It is like two different sides of the same coin. Heads and tails are the same in many ways. Gay couples have the same rights as heterosexual couples. They should be able to get married and have the same legal protections.

Many people worry about adoption and how children will adjust. However, studies show that children of gay couples are just as healthy and happy as children of heterosexual couples. The main problem is how others treat them in society.

The government should make gay marriage legal in all states. The amendment against it is not fair. It is like segregation. It treats people differently based on their sexual orientation. This is not right.

President Bush has strong views against gay marriage. He believes it is a moral issue. But morality is not the same for everyone. Some people's beliefs should not be used to make laws for everyone.

Many people are against gay marriage because they believe it is a sign of psychological damage. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says this is not true. People should listen to studies and experts, not just friends and neighbors.

I work at a hospital pharmacy this summer. Sometimes, people think drugs are bad just because they are illegal. I say, just because a drug is illegal does not mean it is not useful for medicine. Some drugs, like oxycodone, are illegal but doctors use them because they help people. Marijuana is like this. Many people think it is bad, but it is not like drugs like heroin or cocaine. I think we should look at marijuana differently. If we remove the bad image of it, people might use it responsibly. Then, if we make it legal, it could be helpful.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was younger, I always went to church every Sunday. I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, the church has a teenager mass that is only thirty minutes long. People wear casual clothes, even beach clothes in summer. Sometimes, people are late. They wear jeans and khakis. I do not know the politics of the church, but this is what I have noticed.

Regarding the accusations against Catholic priests dealing with pedophilia, I do not think these could have been prevented by changing the church. Men can be married and still become pedophiles. I think this is a genetics issue, not something the church can fix. Even if priests were allowed to get married, it would not change them. They could become pedophiles anyway. They chose to be priests. There are religions where priests can get married, like in Seventh Heaven. If they want to practice their faith and get married, they should consider another religion. The church could not have prevented this from happening if they did not know. If they tried to cover it up, that is shameful. But I do not think they always knew. That is all I have to say about the Catholic church.

I thought the idea was okay, but many people were still upset about the September 11th attacks. The Bush administration used the Iraq war to catch Osama Bin Laden. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction, but this was not true. This made me very angry.

The Bush administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who gave a big presentation at the UN, said he was not convinced by the evidence. This is like a crime, and it should be an impeachable offense.

I think the Bush administration does not care about the constitution. They want to go to war. I think they also want to get more oil. The Secretary of the Treasury said this in his book. The younger Bush was angry about his dad's administration. He wanted revenge against Saddam Hussein.

I think the war has been going on for too long. If we leave now, there will be a civil war. Many more people will die. The UN and the United States are making a new plan. They want other countries to help. But this may cause more problems. The interim government is not working well. The Prime Minister cannot control the political process. Radical groups want to control the government. Many people are fighting for control.

I cannot say more about this topic in polite company.

I talk about the War in Iraq. I not know much about. I think it not declared war. I think we just want to make sure Iraq not do bad things. I think we want oil too. But I think no reason to stay there. We try to make democracy, but it take long time. If we leave, Iraq people not happy. We make it worse. I think stay there bad for Bush. It make him look bad. I think we should stop war. But I think we should help them. I think we should not stay there forever. I think it cause more problems. I think people in Iraq have lives too. I think we should help them, but not try to change them. I think it cause more problems. It take long time. I think we should think about it more. That's all.

I think it is not right for a state to make it illegal or for the government to decide this.
The constitution says churches and government should not control each other.
Trying to make it illegal would break this rule.
Most Catholics are against it, but the government should not decide for the churches.
The constitution already has rules about this.
Making a new rule about it would not be right.
I do not think the government should get involved in this.
This is about the person's personal beliefs, not about the economy or society.
The government should let the churches decide.

I think the government was not honest about the war in Iraq. This was a wrong decision. The government said Iraq was linked with the September 11 attacks. This was not true. The government wanted to make people angry about these attacks and so they invaded Iraq in 2003.

I am against war, especially when it is not needed. The government should have been ready for what happened after the war. Many soldiers died. The government did not plan well for this. The US removed the Iraqi government and tried to create a new one. This is like in Vietnam, where the US tried to stop communism.

I think the government should never have started the war. If you go to war, you need to be ready for all possibilities. The government was not ready for the chaos after the war. Many American soldiers are still dying. It is a long process to make a new government work. In our own country, making democracy took a long time.

The US government made people think it would be easy to make Iraq democratic. This is not true. It will take a long time. We should not try to make other countries democratic if we are not ready.

I think the government should finish what they started. But we are risking too many lives. We should think about how much is too much. The war in Iraq has lasted so long. We took away the Iraqi government and their way of life. We cannot just abandon them now.

The war started because of oil. The US wanted to control the oil in Iraq. The government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. This was not true. Other countries with weapons of mass destruction were not attacked. The government is not being honest about its decisions.

I hope the war will end soon. But I do not think it will end soon. I hope for peace in Iraq soon. But probably not.

I support gay marriage. I always have. I think it is a personal choice, not something to decide for others. It is now proven that it can be biological, not just sociological. It is not fair to take away rights from people who cannot control this.

Gay couples function like any other family. In my neighborhood, there are a few openly gay couples. They walk their dogs and live just like anyone else. I do not think it should be a political issue. It is a personal matter. I think it is unfair that straight couples can marry secretly, but gay couples cannot, even if they want to.

I have read and heard that being gay can be a natural part of being human. It is not something people choose or develop. I think marriage should be a private matter, not a public one.

I do not think it is fair that two people who love each other cannot marry just because of their gender.

When you put things on the internet, it is public. Many people see it. Be careful what you write. It can affect people's opinions of you.

If you write about dangerous things, like blowing things up or shootings, people might think you are serious. This can lead to problems. For example, someone might call the police. They can't ignore this because something could happen.

Sometimes, people might write about these things as a joke. But the situation can become serious. School officials need to check if something is serious. If they find something dangerous, they must act.

If you don't want something to be seen, don't put it on the internet. If you want to keep private, don't share it online.

School officials can't check everything on the internet. They can't look at everyone's Facebook or Myspace. But if someone brings them information, they must take it seriously. They must check if there is danger.

Teachers should not create fake accounts to friend students. This is not fair. They shouldn't look at students' private lives. If a student shares something dangerous, the school must act.

Putting things on the internet is a big responsibility. Be careful what you share.

I believe the war has lasted too long. It started with good intentions—to restore democracy. But now, I feel like we have lost our purpose. Maybe the original reasons were not entirely fair. For example, George Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein before. The war might have been started to prove we are a powerful country. Our goal was good at first, but now it seems like we are fighting just to fight. I think we should stop. The Iraqi government should take care of itself. We have been fighting for too long, and it is not good for our economy. We should use our money to fix our own problems, like poverty and healthcare. We should not keep fighting just to fight. It is time to stop.

I have a question. Can I ask about something?
I think I understand how it was prevented. Someone looked at a profile online and saw something.
That's okay. If you put information on the internet, other people can see it.
On Myspace, you have to be a friend to see someone's profile. But you agreed to be their friend, so they can see it.
If you post information, you know many people will see it.
If someone sees something bad and prevents a problem, it's good.
But it's hard to have one person look at everyone's profiles.
That would be unfair.
I don't have Myspace, but I have Facebook. I worry about creepy people seeing my info.
I saw a show about a man who found a girl's screen name quickly and talked with her.
I don't like that. But sometimes, I get messages from people I don't know.
They know my interests, where I am, and my friends.
I try to put up only safe info, but I like to communicate with friends.
It's hard to balance privacy and safety.
I only let my friends see my profile.
But I don't know who else can look.
My roommate's high school banned Myspace. I don't know if that was right.
How did high school officials decide this?
I don't know if that's a privacy issue, but it's unclear why they banned it.
That's all I can think of.

The Iraq War is a complicated subject. I start by saying, "Hmm, I only have this and one more thing to talk about it. I feel hypocritical talking about it. I hate to join the bandwagon of people who say they were against it from the start. But, it's not important anymore.

The general consensus is that the war was a bad idea. Polls show that 75-80% of the world thinks it was a bad idea. 80% of Iraqis and 70% of U.S. troops think it was a dumb idea. They think we should pull out within a year.

The war started before we went in. It is still a disaster. Pulling out will also be a disaster. It's hard to make good decisions in the Middle East.

The culture of the Middle East is very different from ours. The U.S. and previous administrations think we can bring democracy where it shouldn't exist. This is a big mistake. Saddam was a bad leader, but we should consider the pros and cons before invading.

The war is like quicksand. We don't know what to say about it. I don't see a reason to stay. The administration might have hopeful ideas, but I haven't heard a good reason to stay longer.

I read that 80% of Iraqis want us to leave within a year, and 25% want us to leave now. We should ask them what to do.

If we ask and they say to leave, we can say we tried to help, but they decided not to. We can be the good guys if we help later.

We might never be the good guys in the Middle East, but it will be better than staying now.

Gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It affects many fields of work and not only women. For example, men in certain fields, like fashion, may face discrimination because people do not take them seriously.

Men who stay at home with children also face discrimination. People may look down on them because society expects men to be breadwinners. In contrast, women are often expected to be the primary caregivers for children.

Even in the business world, women still face the glass ceiling. Many women qualify for high-level positions, but they are not promoted because of their gender.

Slowly, society is changing. Women are becoming CEOs and more accepted in the business world. Men who stay at home are also being accepted more. People are learning that a woman can have the better job and a man can stay at home.

In fashion, men are starting to be taken more seriously. They are learning to listen to their female friends and wives about fashion.

Discrimination also happens between men of different backgrounds. A man from a farm with good intelligence but poor grammar might be looked down upon in a CEO job. People might question his intelligence because of his grammar.

This is about marijuana. People did not make it legal. They made it less bad. They changed it from a big crime to a small ticket. If someone gets a ticket, it might affect jobs. It might make people think bad things about the person. In some places, it costs a lot to arrest and punish people. Some places do not want to do this. Denver is good with this. They spend money on schools and social programs. Marijuana is not good if it is everywhere. It is not like cigarettes, which can be bought in stores. People might smoke it in cars. It is bad in our society. Alcohol is worse for driving, but marijuana can change a person's life. People react to substances differently. Some can use it and others cannot.

I say yes.
Many things in the Catholic Church are traditional and good. But it is also important to change when needed.
Some Catholics go to church every week. They follow the rules closely. They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. This is not fair and not kind.
My parents faced this problem. My dad was an Episcopalian. My mom was Catholic. They did not marry in the Catholic Church. This was not right.
The church teaches to love others. But it does not always do this in practice. This is not fair.
I think priests should be allowed to marry. But I do not think this would stop pedophilic behavior. It is a different problem.
People who hurt children might do this even if priests were married. This is a different issue.
So, I think priests should be allowed to marry. But this would not stop the bad behavior.

I have not decided yet. This topic is difficult. It is close to the separation of church and state. It is also about how to define marriage. This is tricky. I do not know if either side is right or wrong.

I think all civil unions should be equal. If two people are together, they should be treated the same. Marriage should not be defined by the government. People should not get tax breaks just for being married.

If all states agree, they should make it federal law. But a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not necessary. It is not important enough to change the constitution for this reason.

I was raised in a Christian home. Homosexuality is a complicated issue for me because I have many gay friends. I do not agree with the lifestyle, but I think it should be legalized. I believe each state should decide, not the president. Democratic states will likely legalize it, but I do not disagree if a state chooses to do so. The president should not decide for the whole country. I do not feel Bush should ban gay marriage. He does not live in every state, and his decision will not affect how states want to run themselves. I think some issues should be decided by each state. Plus, he will be out of office in two years. A new president may lift the ban, and it will just change back and forth. I think states should make their own decisions because they live with the results, not the president.

I do not agree with the idea of school officials using Myspace to catch students. It is a public site where students post for others to see. If they go on to check for students doing wrong things, like drinking or smoking, it is like spying. This is an invasion of privacy. However, if they use it to make the school safer, like to prevent school shootings, it is okay. School officials should not use it just to catch students. But if they find something that can make the school safer, they should use it. These officials are just doing their job to make the school a better and safer place for everyone. This is similar to what happens in our school. We practice lock downs to be safe from terrorists. We do this to protect students. The school officials are just doing the same. They are making sure students are safe. They are not invading privacy. They are making the school a safer place. That is their job.

War in Iraq
I was all for it at first because of 9/11, but I changed my mind. I think we went over there unprepared and without a plan. We should have thought about the long-term effects. I wanted revenge, but now I think we should leave. I don’t think Iraqis will ever change.

I don’t think they care about rebuilding their country. They just want us to go away. We should have a better plan and more unity. We were emotional and angry when we went there. We created more chaos than we fixed. I think the people in Iraq will always fight each other. We are not making enough progress. We should leave. We can’t stay there forever. It is hurting us more than it is helping.

transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some things. It has been losing people because it is not very accepting.
They have strong views on things like same-sex marriage, abortion, and birth control.
Some people do not agree with these views. They think the Church should consider new ideas.
The Church is against abortion. If you believe in it, you might not feel comfortable.
The same is true for same-sex marriage. If you believe in it, you might not feel right in a Church that does not agree.
I do not see a reason why priests cannot be married or have female priests.
But I do not think these changes would have stopped people from leaving.
Many people like the idea of priests being married. It would be like their job and family life.

I think people are born gay, not choose it. So, I agree with same-sex marriage. I do not believe the federal government should interfere. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is about people's personal lives. I think the government should not make rules about this. It is wrong to punish people for being gay.

I think that gay marriage should be legal.
Because there is no good reason not to.
Many people think that homosexual couples are a threat to traditional families.
But it is different.
There are many aspects to it.
It is like two sides of the same coin.
Heads will not be tails.
But it is the same thing.
And there are many civil rights connected with it, like property taxes and health care.
If you are in a gay couple, your partner cannot be with you if you are sick.
They cannot visit you.
Because they are not legally your family.
I think this is silly if you are going to spend your life with someone.
Many scientific studies show that homosexual couples are just as successful as heterosexual couples.
It is just a relationship.
It is the same thing.
And many people get hung up on things like church involvement.
Homosexuals are not asking to get married in a church.
They are asking for a marriage certificate.
If there is no church involvement, this should not be a problem.
I cannot understand why Catholics get hung up on this.
In a legal sense, if you are allowed a civil union, why not a marriage?
It is like segregation: separate but unequal.
They are the same in many ways, like relationships and community involvement.
People worry about adoption and how children of gay couples will adjust to society.
But again, it is hard to know for sure.
I think the federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state.
I think the amendment should say the opposite.
But President Bush has strong views on this.
He believes it goes with his views on abortion and stem cell research.
Most reasons I hear are moral reasons.
Morality differs from person to person.
To embrace one group's morality while ignoring others is unethical.
To make a law based on religious beliefs is hypocritical, considering recent controversies.
Many people are against gay marriage because they believe gay people are damaged.
This is not true, according to the American Psychological Association.
People should listen to real research, not just popular opinion.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Some drugs are illegal but have beneficial properties. I think it is not good to keep them away from people. I think it is okay to use them for medicine.

There are many illegal drugs that we use in pharmacies. Like oxycodone, vicodin, and perocet. These are controlled substances, but they help people. So we should not deny the good things because of a taboo around marijuana.

I do not think marijuana is like alcohol. If people abuse alcohol, it can lead to bad things. But marijuana is less harmful than heroine or cocaine.

I think we should first remove the bad image people have of marijuana. Then people might use it responsibly. And we can make it legal gradually, not all at once.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was younger, I went to church every Sunday in a cute little dress, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, there is a special mass for teenagers that lasts only thirty minutes. People dress more casually, especially during summer when people come in beach clothes. Even during morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis. The church I know does not involve much politics. I think these changes do not affect the accusations against Catholic priests. I do not think the church could have stopped these issues. Even if priests could marry, some men have pedophilia because of genetics, not because they are married or not married. I think the church could have done more to prevent cover-ups. I do not have other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

Many people were upset after September 11th. Some felt that the Iraq war was a mistake. The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. But this was not true. This made people angry. The Bush administration did not tell the truth about Iraq. This was like a crime. Colin Powell, who was a helper to the president, later said he was not sure about the evidence he gave to the United Nations. This made people very angry. The Bush administration did not care about the constitution. They wanted to go to war. Some people think they wanted to get more oil. The war has been going on a long time. Withdrawing might cause more problems. Civil war might start. Some people think other countries can help. But this might not help in the long term. The Iraq government is not strong. The Parliament is not working well. The country is very divided. It is hard to fix the problem.

I don't feel good about the War in Iraq. It started because we thought Iraq did something. Maybe they bombed the U.S. Maybe they were behind the 9/11 attacks. I don't know the details. I don't like it. I think we're there to create democracy and get oil. But people are upset. It's hard to help them quickly. If we leave, they'll be angry. If we stay, they might hate us more. I think it's a problem. It's hard to say if it should continue. I feel bad for Bush. He looks bad. It's like the Vietnam War. It might never end. I don't want to see kids hurt. But they have different cultures. If we stay, it might make it worse. I think it will go on for a long time.

I do not think it is right for a law to be made or for a state to make it illegal. The constitution says separation of church and state. I think this issue should be decided by the churches, not the government. It is clear in the constitution that churches should make the rules for themselves. Trying to make a law for this would go against the constitution. This is not the first time this has happened, and it will not be the last. I do not believe the federal government or any government should be involved in this issue. This is a personal belief issue. The president is pushing for this amendment because he is a Catholic and wants it to be against his personal beliefs. It is not a good idea to make a law for this issue because it could affect the economy or society in a bad way.

The war in Iraq. Many people think the government did not tell the truth about why they wanted to invade Iraq. They said it was to stop terrorists connected to the attacks of September 11th, but this was not true. The government wanted to make people angry about 9/11 and start the war in 2003.

I am against war. Especially when it is a surprise attack. The government should have learned from the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers died there, and the government was not ready for what happened after removing the government.

The government should have planned for all possible results. They did not. Many American soldiers are still dying, and the Iraqis need help to run their country. It is hard to make a new government. It took a long time in our own country.

In the election, I thought George Bush should finish what he started. But many American soldiers are dying. We need to think about when is enough enough. Why only Iraq? It might be about oil.

Let's hope the war ends soon. But probably not.

I support gay marriage. I believe it is a personal choice. People should not be denied rights because of their biological makeup. It is unfair and inhumane. I have always been an advocate for gay marriage. I think politics and government should not interfere with personal choices. It is a private matter, not a public one. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live just like any other family. They are not married because they are not allowed to be. I think it is ridiculous that Bush wants to interpret marriage his own way. I believe that being gay is often biological, not sociological. People are born this way, not because of their upbringing. I think if a couple wants to marry, it should be a private, not public, matter.

When you put things on the internet, they can be seen by anyone. It is a public place. As an R.A., I have dealt with this. When someone posts about dangerous things, the school must do something. They cannot ignore it. But, not everything is true. Sometimes, students say funny things. The school must decide if it is serious. If someone worries about a student, the school can check their internet. If the student does something wrong, the school can act. But, the student can also hide their internet life. If the school does not want to check, they should not. If someone tells the school about something serious, they must act. But, teachers should not be friends on social network sites. It is not fair to students. I do not want to know what my residents do on the internet. I do not want to be their friend on social network sites. That is not my job.

Long war is not good. Start was fine. Goal was to help democracy. But lost purpose now. Not good. Maybe reason was personal. Bush’s father had problems with Saddam Hussein. Such personal matters not fair. Many months passed. Purpose not clear anymore. Just war for war. Need end. Other issues important. Money spent on war could help here.

I have a question about something. I want to know if you can explain it.

Can I ask a question? It is about something that happened. Someone went online and found something bad. That person stopped it before it happened.

Is that okay? No, I don't think it is an invasion of privacy. If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. On Myspace, you must be a member to see someone’s profile. You have to accept them as a friend.

If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. But if I think something bad could happen, it is good that someone saw it. It stopped something bad from happening.

Is it bad to look at other people's profiles? It is not good to look at everyone's profiles. It is not right to discriminating against people. But if someone is looking for bad things, then it is okay.

I don't have a Myspace. I have a Facebook. I don't like that people can see my information. I saw something on TV about a man who talked to a girl on the internet and met her in less than a minute. I don't think it is safe. Sometimes people in my classes ask me to chat with them, and I don't know who they are. They know my interests, where I am during the day, and my friends. It is hard to know who can see my information. I try to limit what I put up, but I also want to communicate with my friends. It is a tricky issue.

I heard my roommate talking about her high school. They banned students from having Myspace. I don't understand why the school can tell students they can't have a Myspace. I don't think it is right.

I have a question about the Iraq War. I feel like it's not good to talk about it. Many people say they were against it right from the start. But it's difficult to say now because everyone believes it was a bad idea. The Iraq War has been a disaster since we started.

People in the United States, Iraq, and other countries think it was a mistake. About 80% of Iraqis and U.S. soldiers think it was a bad idea. Many people in the United States want us to leave. I think the Iraq War is a big mistake.

The Middle East is different from the United States. It's hard to bring democracy there. We should not stay in Iraq just because we want to. If we stay, it will be like quicksand. We should leave now. Some people think we should leave gradually, but even then, it's hard to find a good reason to stay.

The people in Iraq want us to leave. About 80% of them think we should leave now. They know better than us. If we leave, we will be good guys. It's better for us to leave now than to stay where we are.

Yes, I feel gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
It affects people in different ways.
For example, women often have a hard time getting jobs because of society's past.
People might not elect a woman to a position just because she is a woman.
Men also face problems.
For instance, it is not common for men to stay at home and take care of children.
Society may think the man should work and make money.
In the fashion industry, people sometimes do not take men seriously.
They might think the man does not understand fashion well.
This happens because men usually have different lifestyles.
In different fields, it is clear that gender discrimination exists.
It is hard to change because society's thoughts are set.
But things are changing slowly.
People are accepting more women in high positions and as stay-at-home fathers.
It takes time for society to change its mindset.

In some places, they no longer punish people for having marijuana. They make it a fine instead of a criminal offense. This does not mean the problems go away. Some people still worry about job interviews. But it costs a lot of money to arrest, book, and bring people to court. Some cities think it is better to make it a fine. They can spend this money on schools and programs for old people and homeless people. But not every city thinks this is a good idea. Some people do not want marijuana to be everywhere. They think it is better to keep it hidden. But some people think it is fine to keep it hidden. They think it is like alcohol. It is not good to drive while using it. It can affect people's lives in different ways. Some people can exercise self-control, but others cannot. It is hard to say if one substance is worse than the other.

I would say yes.
Many things they do are very traditional. They have done the same things for a long time. It's good to have roots in tradition. But it's also important to be flexible and change when needed.

A lot of Catholics attend Church every week. They follow the rules very strictly. Sometimes, they don't accept people who don't follow the rules perfectly. They don't accept people of other religions, like my dad who was an Episcopalian. My parents couldn't marry in the Catholic Church because of this.

I don't think this would change things. Allowing priests to marry might not prevent pedophilic behavior. It's a different kind of issue. People who molest children probably do it regardless of whether they are married. I think allowing priests to marry wouldn't prevent these things from happening.

I am not sure what to think about the issue of same-sex marriage. It is a difficult topic. It is close to the separation of church and state, and it is hard to define marriage without upsetting people. I believe that civil unions are fine. I think that people should not get government tax breaks or special treatment just because they are married in a religious way. If someone is married, they should be treated as a civil union, because that is what it is. Two people united together.

If all states can agree on how same-sex marriage should be handled, they should make it a federal law. However, I do not think that the constitution should be changed to ban same-sex marriage. It is not a big enough issue to amend the constitution.

I grew up in a Christian family, so I think about homosexuality differently. I have many gay friends, but I don't agree with their lifestyle. However, I believe it should be legal. I don't think it should be a national issue. Instead, each state should decide on its own. Many states are Democratic. Democratic states often support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how they feel. I think it's okay to agree with their decision. I believe homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. Therefore, I support legalizing gay marriage based on each state's decision. I don't think the president should decide for everyone. Bush doesn't live in every state, so he shouldn't decide how each state should run. He will be out of office soon, and a Democratic president might lift the ban. It's better for each state to decide. They will deal with the decision, not the president.

No, I don't believe that.
Let's see,
If you look at the definition,
Myspace is a public place.
People post things for others to see.
If you post on the internet,
You must realize that many people, including school officials, will see it.
Whether it's under a school name or not, they can still access it from their homes.
But if it helps prevent something like a school shooting,
I think it's okay.
If they check social media to make sure students are safe,
That's fine.
But if they only do it to catch students in trouble,
That's an invasion of privacy.
I think school officials should only check if it's necessary to make the school safer.
If they find something related to safety,
It's okay.
But if they just check to find trouble,
That's not okay.
I think they should be careful how they use the information they find.
I don't think it should be an invasion of privacy.
If you post something online, it's there forever.
If someone finds it later, you could get into trouble.
You should be careful what you post.
A student shouldn't assume that if they don't get in trouble right away, they won't get in trouble later.
Schools should only check social media if they have a good reason.
They should not just check to find trouble.
They should only check if they suspect something might happen.
They should not check randomly.
School officials should be careful and only check if they have a good reason.

I was upset by the attack. I wanted to fight back. But, I was not happy with how the war started. I think we did not plan well. I think we were too emotional. I think we went to war without a good plan. I think it did not work. I think we should leave. They are fighting with each other. They cannot fight with us. I think they want us to leave. I think we should go. We should not stay there forever. We are hurting ourselves. The war is not going well. I do not think we can make progress. We should leave.

transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some things. It has been losing people because it is not very accepting.
They have strong views on things like same-sex marriage, abortion, and birth control.
Some people do not agree with these views. They think the Church should consider new ideas.
The Church is against abortion. If you believe in it, you might not feel comfortable.
The same is true for same-sex marriage. If you believe in it, you might not feel right in a Church that does not agree.
I do not see a reason why priests cannot be married or have female priests.
But I do not think these changes would have stopped people from leaving.
Many people like the idea of priests being married. It would be like their job and family life.

I think people are born gay, not choose it. So, I agree with same-sex marriage. I do not believe the federal government should interfere. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is about people's personal lives. I think the government should not make rules about this. It is wrong to punish people for being gay.

I think that gay marriage should be legal.
Because there is no good reason not to.
Many people think that homosexual couples are a threat to traditional families.
But it is different.
There are many aspects to it.
It is like two sides of the same coin.
Heads will not be tails.
But it is the same thing.
And there are many civil rights connected with it, like property taxes and health care.
If you are in a gay couple, your partner cannot be with you if you are sick.
They cannot visit you.
Because they are not legally your family.
I think this is silly if you are going to spend your life with someone.
Many scientific studies show that homosexual couples are just as successful as heterosexual couples.
It is just a relationship.
It is the same thing.
And many people get hung up on things like church involvement.
Homosexuals are not asking to get married in a church.
They are asking for a marriage certificate.
If there is no church involvement, this should not be a problem.
I cannot understand why Catholics get hung up on this.
In a legal sense, if you are allowed a civil union, why not a marriage?
It is like segregation: separate but unequal.
They are the same in many ways, like relationships and community involvement.
People worry about adoption and how children of gay couples will adjust to society.
But again, it is hard to know for sure.
I think the federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state.
I think the amendment should say the opposite.
But President Bush has strong views on this.
He believes it goes with his views on abortion and stem cell research.
Most reasons I hear are moral reasons.
Morality differs from person to person.
To embrace one group's morality while ignoring others is unethical.
To make a law based on religious beliefs is hypocritical, considering recent controversies.
Many people are against gay marriage because they believe gay people are damaged.
This is not true, according to the American Psychological Association.
People should listen to real research, not just popular opinion.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Some drugs are illegal but have beneficial properties. I think it is not good to keep them away from people. I think it is okay to use them for medicine.

There are many illegal drugs that we use in pharmacies. Like oxycodone, vicodin, and perocet. These are controlled substances, but they help people. So we should not deny the good things because of a taboo around marijuana.

I do not think marijuana is like alcohol. If people abuse alcohol, it can lead to bad things. But marijuana is less harmful than heroine or cocaine.

I think we should first remove the bad image people have of marijuana. Then people might use it responsibly. And we can make it legal gradually, not all at once.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was younger, I went to church every Sunday in a cute little dress, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, there is a special mass for teenagers that lasts only thirty minutes. People dress more casually, especially during summer when people come in beach clothes. Even during morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis. The church I know does not involve much politics. I think these changes do not affect the accusations against Catholic priests. I do not think the church could have stopped these issues. Even if priests could marry, some men have pedophilia because of genetics, not because they are married or not married. I think the church could have done more to prevent cover-ups. I do not have other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

Many people were upset after September 11th. Some felt that the Iraq war was a mistake. The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. But this was not true. This made people angry. The Bush administration did not tell the truth about Iraq. This was like a crime. Colin Powell, who was a helper to the president, later said he was not sure about the evidence he gave to the United Nations. This made people very angry. The Bush administration did not care about the constitution. They wanted to go to war. Some people think they wanted to get more oil. The war has been going on a long time. Withdrawing might cause more problems. Civil war might start. Some people think other countries can help. But this might not help in the long term. The Iraq government is not strong. The Parliament is not working well. The country is very divided. It is hard to fix the problem.

I don't feel good about the War in Iraq. It started because we thought Iraq did something. Maybe they bombed the U.S. Maybe they were behind the 9/11 attacks. I don't know the details. I don't like it. I think we're there to create democracy and get oil. But people are upset. It's hard to help them quickly. If we leave, they'll be angry. If we stay, they might hate us more. I think it's a problem. It's hard to say if it should continue. I feel bad for Bush. He looks bad. It's like the Vietnam War. It might never end. I don't want to see kids hurt. But they have different cultures. If we stay, it might make it worse. I think it will go on for a long time.

I do not think it is right for a law to be made or for a state to make it illegal. The constitution says separation of church and state. I think this issue should be decided by the churches, not the government. It is clear in the constitution that churches should make the rules for themselves. Trying to make a law for this would go against the constitution. This is not the first time this has happened, and it will not be the last. I do not believe the federal government or any government should be involved in this issue. This is a personal belief issue. The president is pushing for this amendment because he is a Catholic and wants it to be against his personal beliefs. It is not a good idea to make a law for this issue because it could affect the economy or society in a bad way.

The war in Iraq. Many people think the government did not tell the truth about why they wanted to invade Iraq. They said it was to stop terrorists connected to the attacks of September 11th, but this was not true. The government wanted to make people angry about 9/11 and start the war in 2003.

I am against war. Especially when it is a surprise attack. The government should have learned from the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers died there, and the government was not ready for what happened after removing the government.

The government should have planned for all possible results. They did not. Many American soldiers are still dying, and the Iraqis need help to run their country. It is hard to make a new government. It took a long time in our own country.

In the election, I thought George Bush should finish what he started. But many American soldiers are dying. We need to think about when is enough enough. Why only Iraq? It might be about oil.

Let's hope the war ends soon. But probably not.

I support gay marriage. I believe it is a personal choice. People should not be denied rights because of their biological makeup. It is unfair and inhumane. I have always been an advocate for gay marriage. I think politics and government should not interfere with personal choices. It is a private matter, not a public one. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live just like any other family. They are not married because they are not allowed to be. I think it is ridiculous that Bush wants to interpret marriage his own way. I believe that being gay is often biological, not sociological. People are born this way, not because of their upbringing. I think if a couple wants to marry, it should be a private, not public, matter.

When you put things on the internet, they can be seen by anyone. It is a public place. As an R.A., I have dealt with this. When someone posts about dangerous things, the school must do something. They cannot ignore it. But, not everything is true. Sometimes, students say funny things. The school must decide if it is serious. If someone worries about a student, the school can check their internet. If the student does something wrong, the school can act. But, the student can also hide their internet life. If the school does not want to check, they should not. If someone tells the school about something serious, they must act. But, teachers should not be friends on social network sites. It is not fair to students. I do not want to know what my residents do on the internet. I do not want to be their friend on social network sites. That is not my job.

Long war is not good. Start was fine. Goal was to help democracy. But lost purpose now. Not good. Maybe reason was personal. Bush’s father had problems with Saddam Hussein. Such personal matters not fair. Many months passed. Purpose not clear anymore. Just war for war. Need end. Other issues important. Money spent on war could help here.

I have a question about something. I want to know if you can explain it.

Can I ask a question? It is about something that happened. Someone went online and found something bad. That person stopped it before it happened.

Is that okay? No, I don't think it is an invasion of privacy. If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. On Myspace, you must be a member to see someone’s profile. You have to accept them as a friend.

If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. But if I think something bad could happen, it is good that someone saw it. It stopped something bad from happening.

Is it bad to look at other people's profiles? It is not good to look at everyone's profiles. It is not right to discriminating against people. But if someone is looking for bad things, then it is okay.

I don't have a Myspace. I have a Facebook. I don't like that people can see my information. I saw something on TV about a man who talked to a girl on the internet and met her in less than a minute. I don't think it is safe. Sometimes people in my classes ask me to chat with them, and I don't know who they are. They know my interests, where I am during the day, and my friends. It is hard to know who can see my information. I try to limit what I put up, but I also want to communicate with my friends. It is a tricky issue.

I heard my roommate talking about her high school. They banned students from having Myspace. I don't understand why the school can tell students they can't have a Myspace. I don't think it is right.

I have a question about the Iraq War. I feel like it's not good to talk about it. Many people say they were against it right from the start. But it's difficult to say now because everyone believes it was a bad idea. The Iraq War has been a disaster since we started.

People in the United States, Iraq, and other countries think it was a mistake. About 80% of Iraqis and U.S. soldiers think it was a bad idea. Many people in the United States want us to leave. I think the Iraq War is a big mistake.

The Middle East is different from the United States. It's hard to bring democracy there. We should not stay in Iraq just because we want to. If we stay, it will be like quicksand. We should leave now. Some people think we should leave gradually, but even then, it's hard to find a good reason to stay.

The people in Iraq want us to leave. About 80% of them think we should leave now. They know better than us. If we leave, we will be good guys. It's better for us to leave now than to stay where we are.

Yes, I feel gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
It affects people in different ways.
For example, women often have a hard time getting jobs because of society's past.
People might not elect a woman to a position just because she is a woman.
Men also face problems.
For instance, it is not common for men to stay at home and take care of children.
Society may think the man should work and make money.
In the fashion industry, people sometimes do not take men seriously.
They might think the man does not understand fashion well.
This happens because men usually have different lifestyles.
In different fields, it is clear that gender discrimination exists.
It is hard to change because society's thoughts are set.
But things are changing slowly.
People are accepting more women in high positions and as stay-at-home fathers.
It takes time for society to change its mindset.

In some places, they no longer punish people for having marijuana. They make it a fine instead of a criminal offense. This does not mean the problems go away. Some people still worry about job interviews. But it costs a lot of money to arrest, book, and bring people to court. Some cities think it is better to make it a fine. They can spend this money on schools and programs for old people and homeless people. But not every city thinks this is a good idea. Some people do not want marijuana to be everywhere. They think it is better to keep it hidden. But some people think it is fine to keep it hidden. They think it is like alcohol. It is not good to drive while using it. It can affect people's lives in different ways. Some people can exercise self-control, but others cannot. It is hard to say if one substance is worse than the other.

I would say yes.
Many things they do are very traditional. They have done the same things for a long time. It's good to have roots in tradition. But it's also important to be flexible and change when needed.

A lot of Catholics attend Church every week. They follow the rules very strictly. Sometimes, they don't accept people who don't follow the rules perfectly. They don't accept people of other religions, like my dad who was an Episcopalian. My parents couldn't marry in the Catholic Church because of this.

I don't think this would change things. Allowing priests to marry might not prevent pedophilic behavior. It's a different kind of issue. People who molest children probably do it regardless of whether they are married. I think allowing priests to marry wouldn't prevent these things from happening.

I am not sure what to think about the issue of same-sex marriage. It is a difficult topic. It is close to the separation of church and state, and it is hard to define marriage without upsetting people. I believe that civil unions are fine. I think that people should not get government tax breaks or special treatment just because they are married in a religious way. If someone is married, they should be treated as a civil union, because that is what it is. Two people united together.

If all states can agree on how same-sex marriage should be handled, they should make it a federal law. However, I do not think that the constitution should be changed to ban same-sex marriage. It is not a big enough issue to amend the constitution.

I grew up in a Christian family, so I think about homosexuality differently. I have many gay friends, but I don't agree with their lifestyle. However, I believe it should be legal. I don't think it should be a national issue. Instead, each state should decide on its own. Many states are Democratic. Democratic states often support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how they feel. I think it's okay to agree with their decision. I believe homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. Therefore, I support legalizing gay marriage based on each state's decision. I don't think the president should decide for everyone. Bush doesn't live in every state, so he shouldn't decide how each state should run. He will be out of office soon, and a Democratic president might lift the ban. It's better for each state to decide. They will deal with the decision, not the president.

No, I don't believe that.
Let's see,
If you look at the definition,
Myspace is a public place.
People post things for others to see.
If you post on the internet,
You must realize that many people, including school officials, will see it.
Whether it's under a school name or not, they can still access it from their homes.
But if it helps prevent something like a school shooting,
I think it's okay.
If they check social media to make sure students are safe,
That's fine.
But if they only do it to catch students in trouble,
That's an invasion of privacy.
I think school officials should only check if it's necessary to make the school safer.
If they find something related to safety,
It's okay.
But if they just check to find trouble,
That's not okay.
I think they should be careful how they use the information they find.
I don't think it should be an invasion of privacy.
If you post something online, it's there forever.
If someone finds it later, you could get into trouble.
You should be careful what you post.
A student shouldn't assume that if they don't get in trouble right away, they won't get in trouble later.
Schools should only check social media if they have a good reason.
They should not just check to find trouble.
They should only check if they suspect something might happen.
They should not check randomly.
School officials should be careful and only check if they have a good reason.

I was upset by the attack. I wanted to fight back. But, I was not happy with how the war started. I think we did not plan well. I think we were too emotional. I think we went to war without a good plan. I think it did not work. I think we should leave. They are fighting with each other. They cannot fight with us. I think they want us to leave. I think we should go. We should not stay there forever. We are hurting ourselves. The war is not going well. I do not think we can make progress. We should leave.

transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some things. It has been losing people because it is not very accepting.
They have strong views on things like same-sex marriage, abortion, and birth control.
Some people do not agree with these views. They think the Church should consider new ideas.
The Church is against abortion. If you believe in it, you might not feel comfortable.
The same is true for same-sex marriage. If you believe in it, you might not feel right in a Church that does not agree.
I do not see a reason why priests cannot be married or have female priests.
But I do not think these changes would have stopped people from leaving.
Many people like the idea of priests being married. It would be like their job and family life.

I think people are born gay, not choose it. So, I agree with same-sex marriage. I do not believe the federal government should interfere. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is about people's personal lives. I think the government should not make rules about this. It is wrong to punish people for being gay.

I think that gay marriage should be legal.
Because there is no good reason not to.
Many people think that homosexual couples are a threat to traditional families.
But it is different.
There are many aspects to it.
It is like two sides of the same coin.
Heads will not be tails.
But it is the same thing.
And there are many civil rights connected with it, like property taxes and health care.
If you are in a gay couple, your partner cannot be with you if you are sick.
They cannot visit you.
Because they are not legally your family.
I think this is silly if you are going to spend your life with someone.
Many scientific studies show that homosexual couples are just as successful as heterosexual couples.
It is just a relationship.
It is the same thing.
And many people get hung up on things like church involvement.
Homosexuals are not asking to get married in a church.
They are asking for a marriage certificate.
If there is no church involvement, this should not be a problem.
I cannot understand why Catholics get hung up on this.
In a legal sense, if you are allowed a civil union, why not a marriage?
It is like segregation: separate but unequal.
They are the same in many ways, like relationships and community involvement.
People worry about adoption and how children of gay couples will adjust to society.
But again, it is hard to know for sure.
I think the federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state.
I think the amendment should say the opposite.
But President Bush has strong views on this.
He believes it goes with his views on abortion and stem cell research.
Most reasons I hear are moral reasons.
Morality differs from person to person.
To embrace one group's morality while ignoring others is unethical.
To make a law based on religious beliefs is hypocritical, considering recent controversies.
Many people are against gay marriage because they believe gay people are damaged.
This is not true, according to the American Psychological Association.
People should listen to real research, not just popular opinion.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Some drugs are illegal but have beneficial properties. I think it is not good to keep them away from people. I think it is okay to use them for medicine.

There are many illegal drugs that we use in pharmacies. Like oxycodone, vicodin, and perocet. These are controlled substances, but they help people. So we should not deny the good things because of a taboo around marijuana.

I do not think marijuana is like alcohol. If people abuse alcohol, it can lead to bad things. But marijuana is less harmful than heroine or cocaine.

I think we should first remove the bad image people have of marijuana. Then people might use it responsibly. And we can make it legal gradually, not all at once.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was younger, I went to church every Sunday in a cute little dress, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, there is a special mass for teenagers that lasts only thirty minutes. People dress more casually, especially during summer when people come in beach clothes. Even during morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis. The church I know does not involve much politics. I think these changes do not affect the accusations against Catholic priests. I do not think the church could have stopped these issues. Even if priests could marry, some men have pedophilia because of genetics, not because they are married or not married. I think the church could have done more to prevent cover-ups. I do not have other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

Many people were upset after September 11th. Some felt that the Iraq war was a mistake. The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. But this was not true. This made people angry. The Bush administration did not tell the truth about Iraq. This was like a crime. Colin Powell, who was a helper to the president, later said he was not sure about the evidence he gave to the United Nations. This made people very angry. The Bush administration did not care about the constitution. They wanted to go to war. Some people think they wanted to get more oil. The war has been going on a long time. Withdrawing might cause more problems. Civil war might start. Some people think other countries can help. But this might not help in the long term. The Iraq government is not strong. The Parliament is not working well. The country is very divided. It is hard to fix the problem.

I don't feel good about the War in Iraq. It started because we thought Iraq did something. Maybe they bombed the U.S. Maybe they were behind the 9/11 attacks. I don't know the details. I don't like it. I think we're there to create democracy and get oil. But people are upset. It's hard to help them quickly. If we leave, they'll be angry. If we stay, they might hate us more. I think it's a problem. It's hard to say if it should continue. I feel bad for Bush. He looks bad. It's like the Vietnam War. It might never end. I don't want to see kids hurt. But they have different cultures. If we stay, it might make it worse. I think it will go on for a long time.

I do not think it is right for a law to be made or for a state to make it illegal. The constitution says separation of church and state. I think this issue should be decided by the churches, not the government. It is clear in the constitution that churches should make the rules for themselves. Trying to make a law for this would go against the constitution. This is not the first time this has happened, and it will not be the last. I do not believe the federal government or any government should be involved in this issue. This is a personal belief issue. The president is pushing for this amendment because he is a Catholic and wants it to be against his personal beliefs. It is not a good idea to make a law for this issue because it could affect the economy or society in a bad way.

The war in Iraq. Many people think the government did not tell the truth about why they wanted to invade Iraq. They said it was to stop terrorists connected to the attacks of September 11th, but this was not true. The government wanted to make people angry about 9/11 and start the war in 2003.

I am against war. Especially when it is a surprise attack. The government should have learned from the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers died there, and the government was not ready for what happened after removing the government.

The government should have planned for all possible results. They did not. Many American soldiers are still dying, and the Iraqis need help to run their country. It is hard to make a new government. It took a long time in our own country.

In the election, I thought George Bush should finish what he started. But many American soldiers are dying. We need to think about when is enough enough. Why only Iraq? It might be about oil.

Let's hope the war ends soon. But probably not.

I support gay marriage. I believe it is a personal choice. People should not be denied rights because of their biological makeup. It is unfair and inhumane. I have always been an advocate for gay marriage. I think politics and government should not interfere with personal choices. It is a private matter, not a public one. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live just like any other family. They are not married because they are not allowed to be. I think it is ridiculous that Bush wants to interpret marriage his own way. I believe that being gay is often biological, not sociological. People are born this way, not because of their upbringing. I think if a couple wants to marry, it should be a private, not public, matter.

When you put things on the internet, they can be seen by anyone. It is a public place. As an R.A., I have dealt with this. When someone posts about dangerous things, the school must do something. They cannot ignore it. But, not everything is true. Sometimes, students say funny things. The school must decide if it is serious. If someone worries about a student, the school can check their internet. If the student does something wrong, the school can act. But, the student can also hide their internet life. If the school does not want to check, they should not. If someone tells the school about something serious, they must act. But, teachers should not be friends on social network sites. It is not fair to students. I do not want to know what my residents do on the internet. I do not want to be their friend on social network sites. That is not my job.

Long war is not good. Start was fine. Goal was to help democracy. But lost purpose now. Not good. Maybe reason was personal. Bush’s father had problems with Saddam Hussein. Such personal matters not fair. Many months passed. Purpose not clear anymore. Just war for war. Need end. Other issues important. Money spent on war could help here.

I have a question about something. I want to know if you can explain it.

Can I ask a question? It is about something that happened. Someone went online and found something bad. That person stopped it before it happened.

Is that okay? No, I don't think it is an invasion of privacy. If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. On Myspace, you must be a member to see someone’s profile. You have to accept them as a friend.

If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. But if I think something bad could happen, it is good that someone saw it. It stopped something bad from happening.

Is it bad to look at other people's profiles? It is not good to look at everyone's profiles. It is not right to discriminating against people. But if someone is looking for bad things, then it is okay.

I don't have a Myspace. I have a Facebook. I don't like that people can see my information. I saw something on TV about a man who talked to a girl on the internet and met her in less than a minute. I don't think it is safe. Sometimes people in my classes ask me to chat with them, and I don't know who they are. They know my interests, where I am during the day, and my friends. It is hard to know who can see my information. I try to limit what I put up, but I also want to communicate with my friends. It is a tricky issue.

I heard my roommate talking about her high school. They banned students from having Myspace. I don't understand why the school can tell students they can't have a Myspace. I don't think it is right.

I have a question about the Iraq War. I feel like it's not good to talk about it. Many people say they were against it right from the start. But it's difficult to say now because everyone believes it was a bad idea. The Iraq War has been a disaster since we started.

People in the United States, Iraq, and other countries think it was a mistake. About 80% of Iraqis and U.S. soldiers think it was a bad idea. Many people in the United States want us to leave. I think the Iraq War is a big mistake.

The Middle East is different from the United States. It's hard to bring democracy there. We should not stay in Iraq just because we want to. If we stay, it will be like quicksand. We should leave now. Some people think we should leave gradually, but even then, it's hard to find a good reason to stay.

The people in Iraq want us to leave. About 80% of them think we should leave now. They know better than us. If we leave, we will be good guys. It's better for us to leave now than to stay where we are.

Yes, I feel gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
It affects people in different ways.
For example, women often have a hard time getting jobs because of society's past.
People might not elect a woman to a position just because she is a woman.
Men also face problems.
For instance, it is not common for men to stay at home and take care of children.
Society may think the man should work and make money.
In the fashion industry, people sometimes do not take men seriously.
They might think the man does not understand fashion well.
This happens because men usually have different lifestyles.
In different fields, it is clear that gender discrimination exists.
It is hard to change because society's thoughts are set.
But things are changing slowly.
People are accepting more women in high positions and as stay-at-home fathers.
It takes time for society to change its mindset.

In some places, they no longer punish people for having marijuana. They make it a fine instead of a criminal offense. This does not mean the problems go away. Some people still worry about job interviews. But it costs a lot of money to arrest, book, and bring people to court. Some cities think it is better to make it a fine. They can spend this money on schools and programs for old people and homeless people. But not every city thinks this is a good idea. Some people do not want marijuana to be everywhere. They think it is better to keep it hidden. But some people think it is fine to keep it hidden. They think it is like alcohol. It is not good to drive while using it. It can affect people's lives in different ways. Some people can exercise self-control, but others cannot. It is hard to say if one substance is worse than the other.

I would say yes.
Many things they do are very traditional. They have done the same things for a long time. It's good to have roots in tradition. But it's also important to be flexible and change when needed.

A lot of Catholics attend Church every week. They follow the rules very strictly. Sometimes, they don't accept people who don't follow the rules perfectly. They don't accept people of other religions, like my dad who was an Episcopalian. My parents couldn't marry in the Catholic Church because of this.

I don't think this would change things. Allowing priests to marry might not prevent pedophilic behavior. It's a different kind of issue. People who molest children probably do it regardless of whether they are married. I think allowing priests to marry wouldn't prevent these things from happening.

I am not sure what to think about the issue of same-sex marriage. It is a difficult topic. It is close to the separation of church and state, and it is hard to define marriage without upsetting people. I believe that civil unions are fine. I think that people should not get government tax breaks or special treatment just because they are married in a religious way. If someone is married, they should be treated as a civil union, because that is what it is. Two people united together.

If all states can agree on how same-sex marriage should be handled, they should make it a federal law. However, I do not think that the constitution should be changed to ban same-sex marriage. It is not a big enough issue to amend the constitution.

I grew up in a Christian family, so I think about homosexuality differently. I have many gay friends, but I don't agree with their lifestyle. However, I believe it should be legal. I don't think it should be a national issue. Instead, each state should decide on its own. Many states are Democratic. Democratic states often support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how they feel. I think it's okay to agree with their decision. I believe homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. Therefore, I support legalizing gay marriage based on each state's decision. I don't think the president should decide for everyone. Bush doesn't live in every state, so he shouldn't decide how each state should run. He will be out of office soon, and a Democratic president might lift the ban. It's better for each state to decide. They will deal with the decision, not the president.

No, I don't believe that.
Let's see,
If you look at the definition,
Myspace is a public place.
People post things for others to see.
If you post on the internet,
You must realize that many people, including school officials, will see it.
Whether it's under a school name or not, they can still access it from their homes.
But if it helps prevent something like a school shooting,
I think it's okay.
If they check social media to make sure students are safe,
That's fine.
But if they only do it to catch students in trouble,
That's an invasion of privacy.
I think school officials should only check if it's necessary to make the school safer.
If they find something related to safety,
It's okay.
But if they just check to find trouble,
That's not okay.
I think they should be careful how they use the information they find.
I don't think it should be an invasion of privacy.
If you post something online, it's there forever.
If someone finds it later, you could get into trouble.
You should be careful what you post.
A student shouldn't assume that if they don't get in trouble right away, they won't get in trouble later.
Schools should only check social media if they have a good reason.
They should not just check to find trouble.
They should only check if they suspect something might happen.
They should not check randomly.
School officials should be careful and only check if they have a good reason.

I was upset by the attack. I wanted to fight back. But, I was not happy with how the war started. I think we did not plan well. I think we were too emotional. I think we went to war without a good plan. I think it did not work. I think we should leave. They are fighting with each other. They cannot fight with us. I think they want us to leave. I think we should go. We should not stay there forever. We are hurting ourselves. The war is not going well. I do not think we can make progress. We should leave.
