transformed_texts: I think the Catholic Church should change some of its views. People are leaving the church. The church is not accepting of many things. For example, it is against gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old-fashioned. If the church adapts to new ideas, it will keep more followers. People are leaving because the church does not agree with them on these issues. The church is against abortion, so people who support abortion may feel uncomfortable following it. The same is true for gay marriage. Priests cannot be married or have female priests. This is not necessary to keep people in the church. I think priests should be able to have both a job and a family life.

I am not against gay marriage. Some people think it is not a choice. I do not think it is something people can decide. I think people should not be blamed for how they feel. It is wrong to say some people can marry while others cannot. I do not think the federal government should decide this. It is not a legal issue. It is not a moral issue. It is just how people are. They should not be punished for it. The government should not get involved in people's private lives. It is not about security or morals. It is who they are. They should not be blamed for who they are.

Gay marriage should be legal. Two people should have equal rights. People often say gay couples threaten the traditional family. But, this is not true. Each couple is unique. Many people do not want gay couples to have the same rights as straight couples. But, it is not fair. Gay couples also have civil rights. This means they can own property and have health care. They should be able to be with their partners when they are sick. Many studies show gay couples are as happy as straight couples. They have the same factors in relationships. It is just a relationship. They are asking for a legal document, not a church ceremony. People should not mix religion with government. If you allow a civil union, why not allow marriage? Gay couples are the same as straight couples. They have the same relationship roles. They should not be treated differently. Children of gay couples will be fine. They will be treated the same as children of straight couples. The government should help make gay marriage legal. President Bush has strong views on gay marriage. He is against it for moral reasons. But, morality differs from person to person. Many people believe gay people are damaged. But, this is not true. The American Psychological Association says so. People should listen to research, not just friends and neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I think drugs should be illegal, but also useful. Some drugs, like oxycotton and Vicodin, are used in medicine. I think marijuana could be studied for medicine too. The bad image of marijuana is not fair. It is not like heroine or cocaine. I think society should change its mind about marijuana. Then, people could use it responsibly. I think we should not make it legal all at once. We should make it legal gradually.

I think the church has changed a lot to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as it used to be. When I was younger, I always went to church every Sunday. I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse. I went to a private school, and I saw my friends there on weekends. Now, they have a teenager's mass that is only 30 minutes long. People wear casual clothes, even beach clothes. Families are late, and people wear jeans and khakis to morning masses. I think the church is more casual now.

Regarding accusations against Catholic priests, I do not think these things could have been prevented. There are men who are married and still become pedophiles. I think it is based on genetics, not the way they are brought up. The church could not have done anything to prevent this. If they knew and tried to cover it up, that is shameful. But I do not think in all cases they knew. I do not have other thoughts about the Catholic church.

I was okay with the idea at first, but I think everyone was still affected by the September 11th attacks. The Bush administration used these attacks as a reason to go to war in Iraq. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction, but this was not true. This did not sit well with me.

The Bush administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who made a big presentation at the UN, said he wasn't convinced by the evidence at the time. This is a serious issue. I think it's a crime to lie to the American people like that. They didn't care about the Constitution.

The Bush administration wanted to go to war. They started with a desire for revenge against Saddam Hussein because of his father. They also wanted to control Iraq's oil. This is not a good way to act.

We should stop the war now, but it's hard because Iraq might fall into a civil war if we leave. The UN and the US want other countries to help, but this might cause more problems. The government in Iraq is not working well. There is a lot of fighting and disagreement.

I don't know what to do. I can't say more in polite company.

I said I was going to talk about the war in Iraq, but I don't know much about it. I think it's not really a declared war because the U.S. Congress didn't vote for it. I think we are staying there to build democracy, which takes a long time. Also, we want to get oil from Iraq. But I don't think we should stay there because it makes everyone upset. If we leave, they will be mad at us for messing up. I think the war should continue because it's not fair. I don't think we should call it a war anymore because it's not declared by Congress. I think we should help them, but it's also wasting our resources. I feel bad for the families whose sons and daughters are in Iraq. They have lives too. But if we stay there, we might hurt them more. I think the whole thing will go on for a long time. That's about it.

I do not believe it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it as legal. I think this decision should be made by churches. The Constitution says separation of church and state. Trying to enforce power over it would be against the Constitution. Most Catholics and Christians are against it. It is not up to the government to decide what churches can and cannot make illegal. Separation of church and state is important for religious tolerance. Making an amendment about it would be wrong and against what is already in the Constitution. It is a key aspect of the Constitution. The federal government should not be involved in this issue. This amendment is only about one person's personal beliefs. It is not for the benefit of society.

I think the government was not completely honest about the reasons for war. They tried to link the Iraq invasion to the terrorist attacks of September 11th, but there was not a big connection. The government made this link to use the American people's anger after the attacks to start the war in Iraq in 2003. I was against this war, especially because it was a preemptive strike. I think the war was similar to the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers died, and the government did not plan for the future after removing Iraq's government.

The government should have known that turning Iraq into a democratic nation would be hard and take a long time. It was not an easy task, even in our own country. The government made it seem like it would be an easy and short stay in Iraq. But it has taken many years, and many American troops are still dying.

It is hard to decide what to do about Iraq. We cannot abandon them, but we should also not risk too many American lives. The main reason for the invasion was to get oil, and this is why we are not attacking other countries with weapons of mass destruction, like North Korea. I hope the war ends soon and there is peace in Iraq, but it will probably not happen soon.

I support gay marriage. I have always believed it is a personal choice. It is not fair to deny people rights based on something they cannot control.

I think it is not right for government, politics, or even states to decide who can marry. It is a personal matter. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live there. They take care of their homes and families like anyone else. They should be able to marry if they want to.

I have learned that being gay can be a natural part of a person's biology. It is not something that can be changed by growing up or environment. It is like having a certain eye color or hair color.

I think marriage should be a private matter. People should be able to marry without having their decisions reported in the news. It should not be a public issue.

No, I do not think marriage should be a public or national issue.

When you put something on the internet, many people can see it. It is a public place. As a Resident Assistant, I have seen this happen. When something is said online, it can affect people's opinions about you. If you write about harmful things, like blowing things up or shootings, people might get worried. They might tell the school. The school must act on this because they need to protect everyone. But sometimes, people write about harmful things as a joke. The school must decide if it is serious or not. They cannot invade your privacy if you put something online. If you do not want people to see something, do not put it online. The school must take warnings seriously if students post dangerous things online. They should not search for information unless a student brings it to their attention. Teachers should not create fake accounts to monitor students online. It is not their job to watch what students do on social media.

I believe the war has lasted too long. Its original purpose was good—to give democracy to another country. However, I think we have lost focus on that goal. Now, it seems like we are fighting just to show our power. Maybe the initial reason involved personal issues between George Bush and Saddam Hussein. If the aim was to give democracy, that was good. But now, our reason seems unclear. We achieved our main goal quickly, but we have kept fighting for years. Many people are dying, and our economy is suffering. We should let the country's officials handle things now. We have our own problems to solve, like poverty and healthcare. It is unfair to spend money on a war that is no longer necessary.

I have a question. Why was this prevented? Because someone went online and found something on Myspace.

No, I don’t think that’s a privacy issue. If you put information on the internet, it’s available for everyone to see. On Myspace, you need to be a friend to see someone’s profile. But if you accept them as a friend, you give them permission. So, you have to accept that many people can see your profile.

I understand. It’s not practical for one person to check everyone’s profile to prevent problems. It could lead to discrimination. But, it depends on the situation. If someone was looking for evidence that a student was planning something, it might be okay.

I don’t have a Myspace, but I have a Facebook. It’s concerning that creepy people can see my information. I saw a TV show about a man who got a girl’s screen name and talked to her online. He met her in less than a minute. I wouldn’t meet someone like that, but it’s hard because people in my classes can find me online. They know my interests and my schedule. I try to limit what I put up, but I also want to keep in touch with friends. It’s a tricky issue.

My roommate’s high school banned students from having Myspace. I don’t know if that’s a privacy issue, but I don’t think the school had the power to tell students they couldn’t have one.

I do not like to talk about the Iraq war.
I feel like I am joining many others who say they opposed it from the start.
But it does not matter now.
Most people think it was a bad idea.
Many people in Iraq and the world think we should leave.
I think it is a disaster.
It was a mistake to go in.
It will be a mistake to pull out.
The Middle East is very different from the United States.
We should not try to bring democracy there.
Saddam was bad, but we should have thought more before we invaded.
It is like quicksand.
I do not know what to say about it.
I do not think we should stay.
We should leave now.
I do not see a reason to stay.
The Iraqis themselves say we should leave.
If they ask us to leave, it is their decision.
We will be the good guys if we leave.
We will never be good guys in the Middle East.
But it will be better than now.

Yes, I believe gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It affects many fields of work. Women face the glass ceiling. Even when qualified, they may not get promoted to top positions because historically, men have held these positions. Men also face issues. For example, men staying at home to raise children often face societal disapproval. In the fashion industry, men may not be taken seriously. People may question their understanding of women's fashion. Discrimination can also happen within groups, like people from different backgrounds or with different job skills. To change this, we must keep working slowly and steadily. It takes time, but progress is being made.

I think they made a new law. Before, it was a crime. Now, it is a small problem like getting a traffic ticket. It means people get cited, not arrested or sent to jail. Many people worry about this for jobs and other things. But it can also save money for communities. Some places need money for schools, old people, and homeless people. This is good, but it is not good for everyone. People might smoke it in public places. It is not accepted in many places. Some people think alcohol is worse. But some people react differently. It is difficult to say how people will react.

I like tradition. It is good to stick with old ways. But we must also change with the times. Catholics follow rules for a long time. But these rules can be too rigid. I think we should be more open to others. My parents couldn't marry in the Catholic Church because my dad was not Catholic. Catholics say to love others, but they don't always accept people of other religions. This is not fair. I think it's good for priests to marry. It might help them stay away from bad things like child molestation. But I don't think marriage would stop them from doing wrong. They would still do bad things if they wanted to.

I am not sure yet about this topic. It is very difficult. I think that both sides have good points. It is tricky because marriage is both a religious and a legal matter. I think the government should treat marriage as a civil union. This means that it should not consider it a religious sacrament. People should not get tax breaks or special treatment just because they are married. But, if all states agree, they should make it a federal law. However, a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not necessary. The constitution should not be changed for something that affects only a small group of people.

I do not think it is important enough to amend the constitution to ban gay marriage.

I grew up in a Christian home. So, I think about homosexuality. I have friends who are homosexual. I don’t agree with their lifestyle. But, I think it should be legal. I don’t think it should be a national issue. I think each state should decide. Democratic states will support gay marriage. If you live there, it is your choice. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. So, it should be legal on a state level. I don’t think Bush should decide for the whole country. I think each state should decide. Bush shouldn’t decide for every state. He won’t be in office for long. If a Democratic president lifts the ban, it will change back. It should be up to each state. They will live with the decision.

I do not think the school officials were wrong to see a student's Myspace page. It is a public thing. If students post something, it is for others to see. School officials have the right to see it, even at home, because they want to keep students safe. If they find something that could cause a school shooting, they should look at it. This keeps the school a safe place for students. I think it is not an invasion of privacy, because the student put it on the internet for the public to see. However, if the officials go on the internet to catch students, that is wrong. They should only look if they have a good reason, like making the school safer. They have a responsibility to keep students safe, just like parents do when they drop their children off at school. In my high school, we had to practice for emergencies, like school shootings. We did this to make our school a safer place. That is what the school officials are doing here. They are preventing bad things from happening.

The war. I was for it at first. I felt strongly about it because of 9/11. I wanted to fight back, to create damage there as they did here. But now, I am very against it. I don't think it has done anything good. I think the people there, if they can't get along with each other, they can't fight us. I don't think being there is helping. They are still fighting among themselves. I don't care about what happens there anymore. It's like they don't care about anything. They just fight and fight. I don't know why they do it. They don't want to improve their country. They just want us to leave. I think we should just leave. We went over there without a plan. We didn't know what to expect. War is different for them. They are savage. I think we went there just for revenge. President Bush wanted to go to war. I understand where he was coming from. We had to do something after 9/11. But we could have done better. We didn't have a clear plan. We didn't know what to do to create order. We just went there with anger and emotion. We created more anger and emotion there. I don't think we can change them. They will always be like that. We aren't making enough progress. We can't stay there forever. We are just hurting ourselves by staying. We should leave.

transformed_texts: I think the Catholic Church should change some of its views. People are leaving the church. The church is not accepting of many things. For example, it is against gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old-fashioned. If the church adapts to new ideas, it will keep more followers. People are leaving because the church does not agree with them on these issues. The church is against abortion, so people who support abortion may feel uncomfortable following it. The same is true for gay marriage. Priests cannot be married or have female priests. This is not necessary to keep people in the church. I think priests should be able to have both a job and a family life.

I am not against gay marriage. Some people think it is not a choice. I do not think it is something people can decide. I think people should not be blamed for how they feel. It is wrong to say some people can marry while others cannot. I do not think the federal government should decide this. It is not a legal issue. It is not a moral issue. It is just how people are. They should not be punished for it. The government should not get involved in people's private lives. It is not about security or morals. It is who they are. They should not be blamed for who they are.

Gay marriage should be legal. Two people should have equal rights. People often say gay couples threaten the traditional family. But, this is not true. Each couple is unique. Many people do not want gay couples to have the same rights as straight couples. But, it is not fair. Gay couples also have civil rights. This means they can own property and have health care. They should be able to be with their partners when they are sick. Many studies show gay couples are as happy as straight couples. They have the same factors in relationships. It is just a relationship. They are asking for a legal document, not a church ceremony. People should not mix religion with government. If you allow a civil union, why not allow marriage? Gay couples are the same as straight couples. They have the same relationship roles. They should not be treated differently. Children of gay couples will be fine. They will be treated the same as children of straight couples. The government should help make gay marriage legal. President Bush has strong views on gay marriage. He is against it for moral reasons. But, morality differs from person to person. Many people believe gay people are damaged. But, this is not true. The American Psychological Association says so. People should listen to research, not just friends and neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I think drugs should be illegal, but also useful. Some drugs, like oxycotton and Vicodin, are used in medicine. I think marijuana could be studied for medicine too. The bad image of marijuana is not fair. It is not like heroine or cocaine. I think society should change its mind about marijuana. Then, people could use it responsibly. I think we should not make it legal all at once. We should make it legal gradually.

I think the church has changed a lot to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as it used to be. When I was younger, I always went to church every Sunday. I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse. I went to a private school, and I saw my friends there on weekends. Now, they have a teenager's mass that is only 30 minutes long. People wear casual clothes, even beach clothes. Families are late, and people wear jeans and khakis to morning masses. I think the church is more casual now.

Regarding accusations against Catholic priests, I do not think these things could have been prevented. There are men who are married and still become pedophiles. I think it is based on genetics, not the way they are brought up. The church could not have done anything to prevent this. If they knew and tried to cover it up, that is shameful. But I do not think in all cases they knew. I do not have other thoughts about the Catholic church.

I was okay with the idea at first, but I think everyone was still affected by the September 11th attacks. The Bush administration used these attacks as a reason to go to war in Iraq. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction, but this was not true. This did not sit well with me.

The Bush administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who made a big presentation at the UN, said he wasn't convinced by the evidence at the time. This is a serious issue. I think it's a crime to lie to the American people like that. They didn't care about the Constitution.

The Bush administration wanted to go to war. They started with a desire for revenge against Saddam Hussein because of his father. They also wanted to control Iraq's oil. This is not a good way to act.

We should stop the war now, but it's hard because Iraq might fall into a civil war if we leave. The UN and the US want other countries to help, but this might cause more problems. The government in Iraq is not working well. There is a lot of fighting and disagreement.

I don't know what to do. I can't say more in polite company.

I said I was going to talk about the war in Iraq, but I don't know much about it. I think it's not really a declared war because the U.S. Congress didn't vote for it. I think we are staying there to build democracy, which takes a long time. Also, we want to get oil from Iraq. But I don't think we should stay there because it makes everyone upset. If we leave, they will be mad at us for messing up. I think the war should continue because it's not fair. I don't think we should call it a war anymore because it's not declared by Congress. I think we should help them, but it's also wasting our resources. I feel bad for the families whose sons and daughters are in Iraq. They have lives too. But if we stay there, we might hurt them more. I think the whole thing will go on for a long time. That's about it.

I do not believe it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it as legal. I think this decision should be made by churches. The Constitution says separation of church and state. Trying to enforce power over it would be against the Constitution. Most Catholics and Christians are against it. It is not up to the government to decide what churches can and cannot make illegal. Separation of church and state is important for religious tolerance. Making an amendment about it would be wrong and against what is already in the Constitution. It is a key aspect of the Constitution. The federal government should not be involved in this issue. This amendment is only about one person's personal beliefs. It is not for the benefit of society.

I think the government was not completely honest about the reasons for war. They tried to link the Iraq invasion to the terrorist attacks of September 11th, but there was not a big connection. The government made this link to use the American people's anger after the attacks to start the war in Iraq in 2003. I was against this war, especially because it was a preemptive strike. I think the war was similar to the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers died, and the government did not plan for the future after removing Iraq's government.

The government should have known that turning Iraq into a democratic nation would be hard and take a long time. It was not an easy task, even in our own country. The government made it seem like it would be an easy and short stay in Iraq. But it has taken many years, and many American troops are still dying.

It is hard to decide what to do about Iraq. We cannot abandon them, but we should also not risk too many American lives. The main reason for the invasion was to get oil, and this is why we are not attacking other countries with weapons of mass destruction, like North Korea. I hope the war ends soon and there is peace in Iraq, but it will probably not happen soon.

I support gay marriage. I have always believed it is a personal choice. It is not fair to deny people rights based on something they cannot control.

I think it is not right for government, politics, or even states to decide who can marry. It is a personal matter. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live there. They take care of their homes and families like anyone else. They should be able to marry if they want to.

I have learned that being gay can be a natural part of a person's biology. It is not something that can be changed by growing up or environment. It is like having a certain eye color or hair color.

I think marriage should be a private matter. People should be able to marry without having their decisions reported in the news. It should not be a public issue.

No, I do not think marriage should be a public or national issue.

When you put something on the internet, many people can see it. It is a public place. As a Resident Assistant, I have seen this happen. When something is said online, it can affect people's opinions about you. If you write about harmful things, like blowing things up or shootings, people might get worried. They might tell the school. The school must act on this because they need to protect everyone. But sometimes, people write about harmful things as a joke. The school must decide if it is serious or not. They cannot invade your privacy if you put something online. If you do not want people to see something, do not put it online. The school must take warnings seriously if students post dangerous things online. They should not search for information unless a student brings it to their attention. Teachers should not create fake accounts to monitor students online. It is not their job to watch what students do on social media.

I believe the war has lasted too long. Its original purpose was good—to give democracy to another country. However, I think we have lost focus on that goal. Now, it seems like we are fighting just to show our power. Maybe the initial reason involved personal issues between George Bush and Saddam Hussein. If the aim was to give democracy, that was good. But now, our reason seems unclear. We achieved our main goal quickly, but we have kept fighting for years. Many people are dying, and our economy is suffering. We should let the country's officials handle things now. We have our own problems to solve, like poverty and healthcare. It is unfair to spend money on a war that is no longer necessary.

I have a question. Why was this prevented? Because someone went online and found something on Myspace.

No, I don’t think that’s a privacy issue. If you put information on the internet, it’s available for everyone to see. On Myspace, you need to be a friend to see someone’s profile. But if you accept them as a friend, you give them permission. So, you have to accept that many people can see your profile.

I understand. It’s not practical for one person to check everyone’s profile to prevent problems. It could lead to discrimination. But, it depends on the situation. If someone was looking for evidence that a student was planning something, it might be okay.

I don’t have a Myspace, but I have a Facebook. It’s concerning that creepy people can see my information. I saw a TV show about a man who got a girl’s screen name and talked to her online. He met her in less than a minute. I wouldn’t meet someone like that, but it’s hard because people in my classes can find me online. They know my interests and my schedule. I try to limit what I put up, but I also want to keep in touch with friends. It’s a tricky issue.

My roommate’s high school banned students from having Myspace. I don’t know if that’s a privacy issue, but I don’t think the school had the power to tell students they couldn’t have one.

I do not like to talk about the Iraq war.
I feel like I am joining many others who say they opposed it from the start.
But it does not matter now.
Most people think it was a bad idea.
Many people in Iraq and the world think we should leave.
I think it is a disaster.
It was a mistake to go in.
It will be a mistake to pull out.
The Middle East is very different from the United States.
We should not try to bring democracy there.
Saddam was bad, but we should have thought more before we invaded.
It is like quicksand.
I do not know what to say about it.
I do not think we should stay.
We should leave now.
I do not see a reason to stay.
The Iraqis themselves say we should leave.
If they ask us to leave, it is their decision.
We will be the good guys if we leave.
We will never be good guys in the Middle East.
But it will be better than now.

Yes, I believe gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It affects many fields of work. Women face the glass ceiling. Even when qualified, they may not get promoted to top positions because historically, men have held these positions. Men also face issues. For example, men staying at home to raise children often face societal disapproval. In the fashion industry, men may not be taken seriously. People may question their understanding of women's fashion. Discrimination can also happen within groups, like people from different backgrounds or with different job skills. To change this, we must keep working slowly and steadily. It takes time, but progress is being made.

I think they made a new law. Before, it was a crime. Now, it is a small problem like getting a traffic ticket. It means people get cited, not arrested or sent to jail. Many people worry about this for jobs and other things. But it can also save money for communities. Some places need money for schools, old people, and homeless people. This is good, but it is not good for everyone. People might smoke it in public places. It is not accepted in many places. Some people think alcohol is worse. But some people react differently. It is difficult to say how people will react.

I like tradition. It is good to stick with old ways. But we must also change with the times. Catholics follow rules for a long time. But these rules can be too rigid. I think we should be more open to others. My parents couldn't marry in the Catholic Church because my dad was not Catholic. Catholics say to love others, but they don't always accept people of other religions. This is not fair. I think it's good for priests to marry. It might help them stay away from bad things like child molestation. But I don't think marriage would stop them from doing wrong. They would still do bad things if they wanted to.

I am not sure yet about this topic. It is very difficult. I think that both sides have good points. It is tricky because marriage is both a religious and a legal matter. I think the government should treat marriage as a civil union. This means that it should not consider it a religious sacrament. People should not get tax breaks or special treatment just because they are married. But, if all states agree, they should make it a federal law. However, a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not necessary. The constitution should not be changed for something that affects only a small group of people.

I do not think it is important enough to amend the constitution to ban gay marriage.

I grew up in a Christian home. So, I think about homosexuality. I have friends who are homosexual. I don’t agree with their lifestyle. But, I think it should be legal. I don’t think it should be a national issue. I think each state should decide. Democratic states will support gay marriage. If you live there, it is your choice. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. So, it should be legal on a state level. I don’t think Bush should decide for the whole country. I think each state should decide. Bush shouldn’t decide for every state. He won’t be in office for long. If a Democratic president lifts the ban, it will change back. It should be up to each state. They will live with the decision.

I do not think the school officials were wrong to see a student's Myspace page. It is a public thing. If students post something, it is for others to see. School officials have the right to see it, even at home, because they want to keep students safe. If they find something that could cause a school shooting, they should look at it. This keeps the school a safe place for students. I think it is not an invasion of privacy, because the student put it on the internet for the public to see. However, if the officials go on the internet to catch students, that is wrong. They should only look if they have a good reason, like making the school safer. They have a responsibility to keep students safe, just like parents do when they drop their children off at school. In my high school, we had to practice for emergencies, like school shootings. We did this to make our school a safer place. That is what the school officials are doing here. They are preventing bad things from happening.

The war. I was for it at first. I felt strongly about it because of 9/11. I wanted to fight back, to create damage there as they did here. But now, I am very against it. I don't think it has done anything good. I think the people there, if they can't get along with each other, they can't fight us. I don't think being there is helping. They are still fighting among themselves. I don't care about what happens there anymore. It's like they don't care about anything. They just fight and fight. I don't know why they do it. They don't want to improve their country. They just want us to leave. I think we should just leave. We went over there without a plan. We didn't know what to expect. War is different for them. They are savage. I think we went there just for revenge. President Bush wanted to go to war. I understand where he was coming from. We had to do something after 9/11. But we could have done better. We didn't have a clear plan. We didn't know what to do to create order. We just went there with anger and emotion. We created more anger and emotion there. I don't think we can change them. They will always be like that. We aren't making enough progress. We can't stay there forever. We are just hurting ourselves by staying. We should leave.

transformed_texts: I think the Catholic Church should change some of its views. People are leaving the church. The church is not accepting of many things. For example, it is against gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old-fashioned. If the church adapts to new ideas, it will keep more followers. People are leaving because the church does not agree with them on these issues. The church is against abortion, so people who support abortion may feel uncomfortable following it. The same is true for gay marriage. Priests cannot be married or have female priests. This is not necessary to keep people in the church. I think priests should be able to have both a job and a family life.

I am not against gay marriage. Some people think it is not a choice. I do not think it is something people can decide. I think people should not be blamed for how they feel. It is wrong to say some people can marry while others cannot. I do not think the federal government should decide this. It is not a legal issue. It is not a moral issue. It is just how people are. They should not be punished for it. The government should not get involved in people's private lives. It is not about security or morals. It is who they are. They should not be blamed for who they are.

Gay marriage should be legal. Two people should have equal rights. People often say gay couples threaten the traditional family. But, this is not true. Each couple is unique. Many people do not want gay couples to have the same rights as straight couples. But, it is not fair. Gay couples also have civil rights. This means they can own property and have health care. They should be able to be with their partners when they are sick. Many studies show gay couples are as happy as straight couples. They have the same factors in relationships. It is just a relationship. They are asking for a legal document, not a church ceremony. People should not mix religion with government. If you allow a civil union, why not allow marriage? Gay couples are the same as straight couples. They have the same relationship roles. They should not be treated differently. Children of gay couples will be fine. They will be treated the same as children of straight couples. The government should help make gay marriage legal. President Bush has strong views on gay marriage. He is against it for moral reasons. But, morality differs from person to person. Many people believe gay people are damaged. But, this is not true. The American Psychological Association says so. People should listen to research, not just friends and neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I think drugs should be illegal, but also useful. Some drugs, like oxycotton and Vicodin, are used in medicine. I think marijuana could be studied for medicine too. The bad image of marijuana is not fair. It is not like heroine or cocaine. I think society should change its mind about marijuana. Then, people could use it responsibly. I think we should not make it legal all at once. We should make it legal gradually.

I think the church has changed a lot to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as it used to be. When I was younger, I always went to church every Sunday. I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse. I went to a private school, and I saw my friends there on weekends. Now, they have a teenager's mass that is only 30 minutes long. People wear casual clothes, even beach clothes. Families are late, and people wear jeans and khakis to morning masses. I think the church is more casual now.

Regarding accusations against Catholic priests, I do not think these things could have been prevented. There are men who are married and still become pedophiles. I think it is based on genetics, not the way they are brought up. The church could not have done anything to prevent this. If they knew and tried to cover it up, that is shameful. But I do not think in all cases they knew. I do not have other thoughts about the Catholic church.

I was okay with the idea at first, but I think everyone was still affected by the September 11th attacks. The Bush administration used these attacks as a reason to go to war in Iraq. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction, but this was not true. This did not sit well with me.

The Bush administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who made a big presentation at the UN, said he wasn't convinced by the evidence at the time. This is a serious issue. I think it's a crime to lie to the American people like that. They didn't care about the Constitution.

The Bush administration wanted to go to war. They started with a desire for revenge against Saddam Hussein because of his father. They also wanted to control Iraq's oil. This is not a good way to act.

We should stop the war now, but it's hard because Iraq might fall into a civil war if we leave. The UN and the US want other countries to help, but this might cause more problems. The government in Iraq is not working well. There is a lot of fighting and disagreement.

I don't know what to do. I can't say more in polite company.

I said I was going to talk about the war in Iraq, but I don't know much about it. I think it's not really a declared war because the U.S. Congress didn't vote for it. I think we are staying there to build democracy, which takes a long time. Also, we want to get oil from Iraq. But I don't think we should stay there because it makes everyone upset. If we leave, they will be mad at us for messing up. I think the war should continue because it's not fair. I don't think we should call it a war anymore because it's not declared by Congress. I think we should help them, but it's also wasting our resources. I feel bad for the families whose sons and daughters are in Iraq. They have lives too. But if we stay there, we might hurt them more. I think the whole thing will go on for a long time. That's about it.

I do not believe it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it as legal. I think this decision should be made by churches. The Constitution says separation of church and state. Trying to enforce power over it would be against the Constitution. Most Catholics and Christians are against it. It is not up to the government to decide what churches can and cannot make illegal. Separation of church and state is important for religious tolerance. Making an amendment about it would be wrong and against what is already in the Constitution. It is a key aspect of the Constitution. The federal government should not be involved in this issue. This amendment is only about one person's personal beliefs. It is not for the benefit of society.

I think the government was not completely honest about the reasons for war. They tried to link the Iraq invasion to the terrorist attacks of September 11th, but there was not a big connection. The government made this link to use the American people's anger after the attacks to start the war in Iraq in 2003. I was against this war, especially because it was a preemptive strike. I think the war was similar to the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers died, and the government did not plan for the future after removing Iraq's government.

The government should have known that turning Iraq into a democratic nation would be hard and take a long time. It was not an easy task, even in our own country. The government made it seem like it would be an easy and short stay in Iraq. But it has taken many years, and many American troops are still dying.

It is hard to decide what to do about Iraq. We cannot abandon them, but we should also not risk too many American lives. The main reason for the invasion was to get oil, and this is why we are not attacking other countries with weapons of mass destruction, like North Korea. I hope the war ends soon and there is peace in Iraq, but it will probably not happen soon.

I support gay marriage. I have always believed it is a personal choice. It is not fair to deny people rights based on something they cannot control.

I think it is not right for government, politics, or even states to decide who can marry. It is a personal matter. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live there. They take care of their homes and families like anyone else. They should be able to marry if they want to.

I have learned that being gay can be a natural part of a person's biology. It is not something that can be changed by growing up or environment. It is like having a certain eye color or hair color.

I think marriage should be a private matter. People should be able to marry without having their decisions reported in the news. It should not be a public issue.

No, I do not think marriage should be a public or national issue.

When you put something on the internet, many people can see it. It is a public place. As a Resident Assistant, I have seen this happen. When something is said online, it can affect people's opinions about you. If you write about harmful things, like blowing things up or shootings, people might get worried. They might tell the school. The school must act on this because they need to protect everyone. But sometimes, people write about harmful things as a joke. The school must decide if it is serious or not. They cannot invade your privacy if you put something online. If you do not want people to see something, do not put it online. The school must take warnings seriously if students post dangerous things online. They should not search for information unless a student brings it to their attention. Teachers should not create fake accounts to monitor students online. It is not their job to watch what students do on social media.

I believe the war has lasted too long. Its original purpose was good—to give democracy to another country. However, I think we have lost focus on that goal. Now, it seems like we are fighting just to show our power. Maybe the initial reason involved personal issues between George Bush and Saddam Hussein. If the aim was to give democracy, that was good. But now, our reason seems unclear. We achieved our main goal quickly, but we have kept fighting for years. Many people are dying, and our economy is suffering. We should let the country's officials handle things now. We have our own problems to solve, like poverty and healthcare. It is unfair to spend money on a war that is no longer necessary.

I have a question. Why was this prevented? Because someone went online and found something on Myspace.

No, I don’t think that’s a privacy issue. If you put information on the internet, it’s available for everyone to see. On Myspace, you need to be a friend to see someone’s profile. But if you accept them as a friend, you give them permission. So, you have to accept that many people can see your profile.

I understand. It’s not practical for one person to check everyone’s profile to prevent problems. It could lead to discrimination. But, it depends on the situation. If someone was looking for evidence that a student was planning something, it might be okay.

I don’t have a Myspace, but I have a Facebook. It’s concerning that creepy people can see my information. I saw a TV show about a man who got a girl’s screen name and talked to her online. He met her in less than a minute. I wouldn’t meet someone like that, but it’s hard because people in my classes can find me online. They know my interests and my schedule. I try to limit what I put up, but I also want to keep in touch with friends. It’s a tricky issue.

My roommate’s high school banned students from having Myspace. I don’t know if that’s a privacy issue, but I don’t think the school had the power to tell students they couldn’t have one.

I do not like to talk about the Iraq war.
I feel like I am joining many others who say they opposed it from the start.
But it does not matter now.
Most people think it was a bad idea.
Many people in Iraq and the world think we should leave.
I think it is a disaster.
It was a mistake to go in.
It will be a mistake to pull out.
The Middle East is very different from the United States.
We should not try to bring democracy there.
Saddam was bad, but we should have thought more before we invaded.
It is like quicksand.
I do not know what to say about it.
I do not think we should stay.
We should leave now.
I do not see a reason to stay.
The Iraqis themselves say we should leave.
If they ask us to leave, it is their decision.
We will be the good guys if we leave.
We will never be good guys in the Middle East.
But it will be better than now.

Yes, I believe gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It affects many fields of work. Women face the glass ceiling. Even when qualified, they may not get promoted to top positions because historically, men have held these positions. Men also face issues. For example, men staying at home to raise children often face societal disapproval. In the fashion industry, men may not be taken seriously. People may question their understanding of women's fashion. Discrimination can also happen within groups, like people from different backgrounds or with different job skills. To change this, we must keep working slowly and steadily. It takes time, but progress is being made.

I think they made a new law. Before, it was a crime. Now, it is a small problem like getting a traffic ticket. It means people get cited, not arrested or sent to jail. Many people worry about this for jobs and other things. But it can also save money for communities. Some places need money for schools, old people, and homeless people. This is good, but it is not good for everyone. People might smoke it in public places. It is not accepted in many places. Some people think alcohol is worse. But some people react differently. It is difficult to say how people will react.

I like tradition. It is good to stick with old ways. But we must also change with the times. Catholics follow rules for a long time. But these rules can be too rigid. I think we should be more open to others. My parents couldn't marry in the Catholic Church because my dad was not Catholic. Catholics say to love others, but they don't always accept people of other religions. This is not fair. I think it's good for priests to marry. It might help them stay away from bad things like child molestation. But I don't think marriage would stop them from doing wrong. They would still do bad things if they wanted to.

I am not sure yet about this topic. It is very difficult. I think that both sides have good points. It is tricky because marriage is both a religious and a legal matter. I think the government should treat marriage as a civil union. This means that it should not consider it a religious sacrament. People should not get tax breaks or special treatment just because they are married. But, if all states agree, they should make it a federal law. However, a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not necessary. The constitution should not be changed for something that affects only a small group of people.

I do not think it is important enough to amend the constitution to ban gay marriage.

I grew up in a Christian home. So, I think about homosexuality. I have friends who are homosexual. I don’t agree with their lifestyle. But, I think it should be legal. I don’t think it should be a national issue. I think each state should decide. Democratic states will support gay marriage. If you live there, it is your choice. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. So, it should be legal on a state level. I don’t think Bush should decide for the whole country. I think each state should decide. Bush shouldn’t decide for every state. He won’t be in office for long. If a Democratic president lifts the ban, it will change back. It should be up to each state. They will live with the decision.

I do not think the school officials were wrong to see a student's Myspace page. It is a public thing. If students post something, it is for others to see. School officials have the right to see it, even at home, because they want to keep students safe. If they find something that could cause a school shooting, they should look at it. This keeps the school a safe place for students. I think it is not an invasion of privacy, because the student put it on the internet for the public to see. However, if the officials go on the internet to catch students, that is wrong. They should only look if they have a good reason, like making the school safer. They have a responsibility to keep students safe, just like parents do when they drop their children off at school. In my high school, we had to practice for emergencies, like school shootings. We did this to make our school a safer place. That is what the school officials are doing here. They are preventing bad things from happening.

The war. I was for it at first. I felt strongly about it because of 9/11. I wanted to fight back, to create damage there as they did here. But now, I am very against it. I don't think it has done anything good. I think the people there, if they can't get along with each other, they can't fight us. I don't think being there is helping. They are still fighting among themselves. I don't care about what happens there anymore. It's like they don't care about anything. They just fight and fight. I don't know why they do it. They don't want to improve their country. They just want us to leave. I think we should just leave. We went over there without a plan. We didn't know what to expect. War is different for them. They are savage. I think we went there just for revenge. President Bush wanted to go to war. I understand where he was coming from. We had to do something after 9/11. But we could have done better. We didn't have a clear plan. We didn't know what to do to create order. We just went there with anger and emotion. We created more anger and emotion there. I don't think we can change them. They will always be like that. We aren't making enough progress. We can't stay there forever. We are just hurting ourselves by staying. We should leave.
